18141.text: /An evil person will not learn to do good/_even if you show him kindness./He will continue doing evil, even if he lives in a good world./_He never sees the Lord’s greatness.

18142.text: /Lord, you are ready to punish those people./_But they do not see that./Lord, show them your strong love for your people./_Then the evil people will be ashamed./Burn them in the fire/_you have prepared for your enemies.

18143.text: /Lord, all our success is because of what you have done./_So give us peace.

18144.text: /Lord, our God, other masters besides you have ruled us./_But we honor only you.

18145.text: /Those masters are now dead./_Their ghosts will not rise from death./You decided to destroy them./_And you destroyed any memory of them.

18146.text: /Lord, you multiplied the number of your people./_You multiplied them and brought honor to yourself./You made the borders of the land wide.

18147.text: /Lord, people remember you when they are in trouble./_They say quiet prayers to you when you punish them.

18148.text: /Lord, when we are with you,/_we are like a woman giving birth to a baby./_She cries and has pain from the birth.

18149.text: /In the same way, we had pain./_We gave birth, but only to wind./We don’t bring salvation to the land./_We don’t make new people for the world.

18150.text: /Your people have died, but they will live again./_Their bodies will rise from death./Dead people in the ground,/_get up and be happy!/The dew covering you is like the dew of a new day./_The ground will give birth to the dead buried in it.

18151.text: §¶My people, go into your rooms./_Shut your doors behind you./Hide in your rooms for a short time./_Hide until God’s anger is finished.

18152.text: /The Lord will leave his place./_He will punish the people of the world for their sins./The earth will show the blood of the people who have been killed./_It will not cover the dead any longer.

18153.text: ¶At that time the Lord will judge Leviathan, the gliding snake./_He will punish Leviathan, the coiled snake./The Lord will use his great sword,/_his hard and powerful sword./He will kill the monster in the sea.

18154.text: ¶In that day/_people will sing about the pleasant vineyard.

18155.text: /“I, the Lord, will care for that vineyard./_I will water it at the right time./No one will hurt it./_I will guard it day and night.

18156.text: /I am not angry./If anyone builds a wall of thornbushes in war,/_I will march to it and burn it.

18157.text: /But if anyone comes to me for safety/_and wants to make peace with me,/_he should come and make peace with me.”

18158.text: /In the days to come, the people of Jacob will be like a plant with good roots./_Israel will grow like a plant beginning to bloom./_Then the world will be filled with their children.

18159.text: §¶The Lord has not hurt his people as he hurt their enemies./_His people have not been killed like those who tried to kill them.

18160.text: /The Lord will settle his argument with Israel by sending it far away./_Like a hot desert wind, he will drive Israel away.

18161.text: /This is how Israel’s guilt will be forgiven./_This is how its sins will be taken away./Israel will crush the rocks of the altar to dust./_No statues or altars will be left standing for the Asherah idols.

18162.text: /At that time the strong, walled city will be empty./_It will be like a desert./Calves will eat grass there./_They will lie down there./_They will eat leaves from the branches.

18163.text: /The limbs will become dry and break off./_Women will use them for firewood./The people refuse to understand./_So God will not comfort them./_Their Maker will not be kind to them.

18164.text: ¶At that time the Lord will begin gathering his people one by one. He will gather all his people from the Euphrates River to the brook of Egypt. He will separate them from others as grain is separated from chaff.

18165.text: Many of my people are now lost in Assyria. Some of my people have run away to Egypt. But at that time a great trumpet will be blown. And all those people will come back to Jerusalem. They will bow down before the Lord on that holy mountain.

18166.text: §¶How terrible it will be for Samaria, the pride of Israel’s drunken people!/_That beautiful crown of flowers is just a dying plant./It sits on a hill above a rich valley where drunkards live.

18167.text: /Look, the Lord has someone who is strong and full of power./_That person will come like a storm of hail and strong wind./He will come like a sudden flood of water pouring over the country./_He will throw Samaria down to the ground.

18168.text: /That city, the pride of Israel’s drunken people,/_will be trampled underfoot.

18169.text: /That beautiful crown of flowers is just a dying plant./_It sits on a hill above a rich valley./That city will be like the first fig of summer./_When a person sees it,/_he quickly picks it and eats it.

18170.text: ¶At that time the Lord of heaven’s armies/_will be like a beautiful crown./He will be like a wonderful crown of flowers/_for his people who are left alive.

18171.text: /Then the Lord will give wisdom/_to the judges who rule his people./The Lord will give strength/_to those who battle at the city gate.

18172.text: /But now those leaders are drunk with wine./_They stumble from drinking too much beer./The priests and prophets are drunk with beer./_They are filled with wine./They stumble from too much beer./_The prophets are drunk when they see their visions./_The judges stumble when they make their decisions.

18173.text: /Every table is covered with vomit./_There is not a clean place anywhere.

18174.text: ¶The Lord is trying to teach the people a lesson./_He is trying to make them understand his teachings./But the people are like little babies./_They are like babies who just nursed at their mother’s breast.

18175.text: /So they make fun of the Lord’s prophet and say:/_“A command here, a command there./_A rule here, a rule there./_A lesson here, a lesson there.”

18176.text: /So the Lord will use strange words and foreign languages/_to speak to these people.

18177.text: /God said to them,/_“Here is a place of rest./Let the tired people come and rest./_This is the place of peace.”/But the people would not listen.

18178.text: /So the words of the Lord will be,/_“A command here, a command there./_A rule here, a rule there./_A lesson here, a lesson there.”/They will fall back and will be defeated./_They will be trapped and captured.

18179.text: ¶You who brag should listen to the Lord’s message./_Pay attention, you leaders in Jerusalem.

18180.text: /You say, “We have made an agreement with death./_We have a contract with death./When punishment passes by,/_it won’t hurt us./We will be safe with our lies./_We will hide behind our tricks.”

18181.text: ¶Because of these things, this is what the Lord God says:¶▼“I will put a stone in the ground in Jerusalem./_This will be a tested stone./Everything will be built on this important and precious rock./_Anyone who trusts in it will never be disappointed.

18182.text: /I will use justice as a measuring line./_I will use goodness to measure by./The lies you hide behind will be destroyed as if by hail./_They will be washed away as if in a flood.

18183.text: /Your agreement with death will be erased./_Your contract with death will not help you./When punishment comes,/_you will be crushed by it.

18184.text: /Whenever punishment comes, it will take you away./_It will come morning after morning./_It will defeat you by day and by night./Those who hear of this punishment will be terrified.”

18185.text: /You will be like the man who tried to sleep/_on a bed that was too short for him./And his blanket was too narrow/_to wrap around himself.

18186.text: /The Lord will fight as he did at Mount Perazim./_He will be angry as he was in the Valley of Gibeon./Then the Lord will do his work, his strange work./_He will finish his job, his strange job.

18187.text: /Now, you must not make fun of these things./_If you do, the ropes around you will become tighter./The Lord of heaven’s armies has told me these things./_He has told me how the whole earth will be destroyed.

18188.text: §¶Listen closely to what I tell you./_Listen carefully to what I say.

18189.text: /A farmer does not plow his field all the time./_He does not go on working the soil.

18190.text: /He prepares the ground./_Then he plants the dill seed and scatters the cummin seed./He plants the wheat in rows./_He plants barley in its special place,/_and other wheat in its own field.

18191.text: /His God teaches him/_and shows him the right way.

18192.text: /A farmer doesn’t use heavy boards to crush dill./_He doesn’t use a wagon to crush cummin./He uses a small stick to break open the dill./_With a stick he opens the cummin.

18193.text: /The grain is ground to make bread./_People do not ruin it by crushing it forever./The farmer separates the wheat from the chaff with his cart./_But he does not let his horses grind it.

18194.text: /This lesson comes from the Lord of heaven’s armies./_He gives wonderful advice. He is very wise.

18195.text: §¶How terrible it will be for you, Jerusalem./_You are the city where David camped./Her festivals have continued/_year after year.

18196.text: /I will attack Jerusalem./_That city will be filled with sadness and crying./_It will be like an altar to me.

18197.text: /I will put armies all around you, Jerusalem./_I will surround you with towers./_I will build devices around you to attack you.

18198.text: /You will be pulled down and will speak from the ground./_I will hear your voice rising from the ground./It will sound like the voice of a ghost./_Your words will come like a whisper from the dirt.

18199.text: ¶Your many enemies will become like fine dust./_The groups of cruel people will be like chaff that is blown away./Everything will happen very quickly.

18200.text: /_The Lord of heaven’s armies will come./He will come with thunder, earthquakes and great noises./_He will come with storms, strong winds and a fire that destroys.

18201.text: /Then all the nations that fight against Jerusalem/_will be like a dream./All the nations that surround and attack her/_will be like a vision in the night.

18202.text: /They will be like a hungry man who dreams he is eating./_But when he wakes up, he is still hungry./They will be like a thirsty man who dreams he is drinking./_But when he wakes up, he is still weak and thirsty./It will be the same way with all the nations/_who fight against Mount Zion.

18203.text: ¶Be surprised and amazed./_Blind yourselves so that you cannot see./Become drunk, but not from wine./_Trip and fall, but not from beer.

18204.text: /The Lord has made you go into a deep sleep./_He has closed your eyes. (The prophets are your eyes.)/_He has covered your heads. (The seers are your heads.)

18205.text: ¶This vision is like the words of a book that is closed and sealed. You may give the book to someone who can read. And you may tell that person to read it. But he will say, “I can’t read the book. It is closed, and I can’t open it.”

18206.text: Or you may give the book to someone who cannot read. You may tell him to read the book. But he will say, “I can’t read it because I don’t know how to read.”

18207.text: ¶The Lord says:¶▼“These people say they love me./_They show honor to me with words./_But their hearts are far from me./The honor they show me/_is nothing but human rules they have memorized.

18208.text: /So I will continue to amaze these people/_by doing more and more miracles./Their wise men will lose their wisdom./_Their wise men will not be able to understand.”

18209.text: §¶How terrible it will be for those who try/_to hide things from the Lord./How terrible it will be for those who do their work in darkness./_They think no one will see them or know what they do.

18210.text: /You are confused./_You think the clay is equal to the potter./You think that an object can tell the person who made it,/_“You didn’t make me.”/This is like a pot telling its maker,/_“You don’t know anything.”

18211.text: §¶In a very short time, Lebanon will become rich farmland./_And the rich farmland will seem like a forest.

18212.text: /At that time the deaf will hear the words in a book./_Instead of having darkness and gloom, the blind will see.

18213.text: /The Lord will make the poor people happy./_They will rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.

18214.text: /Then the people without mercy will come to an end./_Those who do not respect God will disappear./_Those who enjoy doing evil will be gone.

18215.text: /Those who lie about others in court will be gone./_Those who trap people in court will be gone./_Those who lie and take justice from innocent people in court will be gone.

18216.text: ¶The Lord set Abraham free. This Lord speaks to the family of Jacob.¶▼“Now the people of Jacob will not be ashamed./_They will not be disgraced any longer.

18217.text: /They will see all their children,/_the children I made with my hands./And they will say my name is holy./_The people will agree that the Holy One of Jacob is holy./_They will respect the God of Israel.

18218.text: /People who do wrong will now understand./_Those who complain will accept being taught.”

18219.text: §¶The Lord said,¶▼“How terrible it will be for these stubborn children./They make plans, but they don’t ask me to help them./_They make agreements with other nations, without asking my Spirit./_They are adding more and more sins to themselves.

18220.text: /They go down to Egypt for help,/_but they didn’t ask me about it first./They hope they will be saved by the king of Egypt./_They want Egypt to protect them.

18221.text: /But hiding in Egypt will bring you only shame./_Egypt’s protection will only disappoint you.

18222.text: /Your officers have gone to Zoan./_Your messengers have gone to Hanes.

18223.text: /But they will be put to shame,/_because Egypt is useless to them./Egypt will give no help and be of no use./_It will cause them only shame and embarrassment.”

18224.text: §¶This is the message about the animals in southern Judah:¶▼Southern Judah is a dangerous place./_It is full of lions and lionesses,/_poisonous snakes and darting snakes./The messengers travel through there with their wealth on donkeys’ backs./_They have put their treasure on the backs of camels./They carry them to a nation that cannot help them.

18225.text: /_They go to Egypt whose help is useless./So I call that country Rahab the Do‐Nothing.

18226.text: ¶Now write this on a sign for the people./_Write this on a scroll./Write these things for the days to come./_Write them so they will last forever.

18227.text: /These people are like children who lie and refuse to obey./_They refuse to listen to the Lord’s teachings.

18228.text: /They tell the seers,/_“Don’t see any more visions!”/They say to the prophets,/_“Don’t tell us the truth!/Say things that will make us feel good./_See only good things for us.

18229.text: /Stop blocking our path./_Get out of our way./Stop telling us/_about God, the Holy One of Israel.”

18230.text: ¶So this is what the Holy One of Israel says:¶▼“You people have refused to accept this message from the Lord./_You depended on cruelty and lies to help you.

18231.text: /You are guilty of these things./_So you are like a high wall with cracks in it./_It will fall suddenly and break into small pieces.

18232.text: /You will be like a clay jar that breaks./_It breaks into many pieces./Those pieces will be too small/_to take coals from the fire/_or to get water from a well.”

18233.text: ¶This is what the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel, says:¶▼“If you come back to me and trust me, you will be saved./_If you will be calm and trust me, you will be strong.”/_But you don’t want to do that.

18234.text: /You say, “No, we need horses to run away on.”/_So you will run away on horses./You say, “We will ride away on fast horses.”/_So those who chase you will be fast.

18235.text: /One enemy will make threats,/_and 1,000 of your men will run away./Five enemies will make threats,/_and all of you will run from them./You will be left alone like a flagpole on a hilltop./_You will be like a banner on a hill.

18236.text: /The Lord wants to show his mercy to you./_He wants to rise and comfort you./The Lord is a fair God./_And everyone who waits for his help will be happy.

18237.text: §¶You people who live on Mount Zion in Jerusalem will not cry anymore. The Lord will hear your crying, and he will comfort you. The Lord will hear you, and he will help you.

18238.text: The Lord has given you sorrow and hurt. It was like the bread and water you ate every day. But he is your teacher, and he will not continue to hide from you. You will see your teacher with your own eyes.

18239.text: If you go the wrong way—to the right or to the left—you will hear a voice behind you. It will say, “This is the right way. You should go this way.”

18240.text: You have statues covered with silver and gold. But you will ruin them for further use. You will throw them away like filthy rags. You will say, “Go away!”

18241.text: ¶At that time the Lord will send rain for you. You will plant seeds in the ground, and the ground will grow food for you. The harvest will be very great. You will have plenty of food in the fields for your animals. There will be large fields for your sheep.

18242.text: Your oxen and donkeys will work the soil. They will have all the food they need. You will have to use shovels and pitchforks to spread all the food for your animals to eat.

18243.text: Every mountain and hill will have streams filled with water. These things will happen after many people are killed and the towers are pulled down.

18244.text: At that time the light from the moon will be bright like the sun. The light from the sun will be seven times brighter than now. The light from the sun in one day will be like a full week. These things will happen when the Lord bandages his broken people and heals the hurts he gave them.

18245.text: ¶Look! The Lord comes from far away./_His anger is like a fire with thick clouds of smoke./His mouth is filled with anger,/_and his tongue is like a burning fire.

18246.text: /The Lord’s breath is like a rushing river./_It rises until it reaches the throat./He will judge the nations as if he is sifting them through the strainer of destruction./_He will place in their mouths a bit that will lead them the wrong way.

18247.text: /You will sing happy songs/_as on the nights you begin a festival./You will be happy as people listening to flutes/_as they go to the mountain of the Lord./_The Lord is the Rock of Israel.

18248.text: /The Lord will cause all people to hear his great voice./_He will cause them to see his powerful arm come down./It will come with anger like a great fire that burns everything./_It will be like a great storm with much rain and hail.

18249.text: /Assyria will be afraid when it hears the voice of the Lord./_The Lord will beat Assyria with a rod.

18250.text: /The Lord will punish Assyria with a rod./_He will beat them to the music of tambourines and harps./_The Lord will fight against them with his mighty weapons.

18251.text: /Topheth has been made ready for a long time./_It is ready for the king./It was made deep and wide./_There is much wood and fire there./And the Lord’s breath will come/_like a stream of burning sulfur and burn it.

18252.text: §¶How terrible it will be for those people who go down to Egypt for help./_They think horses will save them./They think their many chariots/_and strong horsemen will save them./They don’t trust God, the Holy One of Israel./_They don’t ask the Lord for help.

18253.text: /But it is the Lord who is wise and who can bring them trouble./_He does not change his warnings./He will rise up and fight against the evil people./_And he will fight against those who try to help evil people.

18254.text: /The Egyptians are only people and are not God./_Their horses are only animals and are not spirit./The Lord will stretch out his arm,/_and the one who helps will stumble./_The people who wanted help will fall./_All of them will be destroyed together.

18255.text: ¶The Lord says this to me:¶▼“When a lion or a lion’s cub kills an animal to eat,/_it stands over the dead animal and roars./A band of shepherds/_may be assembled against it./But the lion will not be afraid of their yelling./_It will not be upset by their noise./So the Lord of heaven’s armies will come down/_to fight on Mount Zion and on its hill.

18256.text: /The Lord of heaven’s armies will defend Jerusalem./_He will defend it like birds flying over their nests./He will defend and save it./_He will ‘pass over’ and save Jerusalem.”

18257.text: ¶You children of Israel, come back to the God that you fought against.

18258.text: The time is coming when each of you will stop worshiping the idols of gold and silver that you made. You truly sinned when you made them.

18259.text: ¶“Assyria will be defeated by a sword, but not the sword of a man./_Assyria will be destroyed, but not by a man’s sword./Assyria will run away from the sword of God./_But their young men will be caught and made slaves.

18260.text: /They will panic, and their place of safety will be destroyed./_Their commanders will be terrified when they see God’s battle flag.”/The Lord said all these things./_The Lord’s fire is in Jerusalem./_His furnace is in Jerusalem.

18261.text: §¶A king will rule in a way that brings justice./_Leaders will make fair decisions.

18262.text: /Then each ruler will be like a shelter from the wind./_He will be like a safe place in a storm./He will be like streams of water in a dry land./_He will be like a cool shadow from a large rock in a hot land.

18263.text: ¶People will look to the king for help./_And they will truly listen to what he says.

18264.text: /People who are now worried will be able to understand./_Those who cannot speak clearly now will then be able to speak clearly and quickly.

18265.text: /Fools will not be called great men./_People will not respect wicked men.

18266.text: /A fool says foolish things./_And in his mind he plans to do evil things./A fool wants to do things that are wrong./_He says wrong things about the Lord./A fool does not feed the hungry./_He does not let thirsty people drink water.

18267.text: /The wicked man uses evil like a tool./_He plans ways to take everything from poor people./He destroys the poor with lies,/_even when the poor man is in the right.

18268.text: /But a good leader plans good things to do./_And those good things make him a good leader.

18269.text: §¶You women who are calm now,/_stand up and listen to me./You women who feel safe now,/_hear what I say.

18270.text: /You women feel safe now,/_but after one year you will be afraid./There will be no grape harvest./_There will not be any summer fruit to gather.

18271.text: /Women, you are calm now, but you should shake with fear./_Women, you feel safe now, but you should tremble./Take off your nice clothes./_Then put rough cloth around your waist to show your sadness.

18272.text: /Beat your breasts in grief because the fields that were pleasant are now empty./_Cry because the vines that once had fruit now have no more grapes.

18273.text: /Cry for the land of my people./_Cry because only thorns and weeds grow there now./Cry for the city that once was happy./_And cry for all the houses that once were filled with joy.

18274.text: /The palace will be empty./_People will leave the noisy city./Strong cities and towers will be empty./_Wild donkeys will love to live there. Sheep will go there to eat.

18275.text: §¶This will continue until God puts his Spirit from above into us./_Then the desert will be like a fertile field./_And the fertile field will be like a forest.

18276.text: /Justice will be found even in the desert./_And fairness will be found in the fertile fields.

18277.text: /That fairness will bring peace./_And fairness will bring calm and safety forever.

18278.text: /My people will live in peaceful places./_They will have safe homes./_They will live in calm places of rest.

18279.text: /Hail will destroy the forest./_And the city will be completely destroyed.

18280.text: /But you will be happy as you plant seeds near every stream./_You will let your cattle and donkeys wander freely.

18281.text: §¶How terrible it will be for you who destroy others./_But you have not been destroyed yet./How terrible it will be for you, traitor./_But no one has turned against you yet./When you stop destroying,/_others will destroy you./When you stop turning against others,/_they will turn against you.

18282.text: ¶Lord, be kind to us./_We have waited for your help./Lord, give us strength every morning./_Save us when we are in trouble.

18283.text: /Your powerful voice makes people run away in fear./_Your greatness causes the nations to run away.

18284.text: /Like locusts, your enemies will take away the things you stole in war./_Like locusts rushing about, they will take your wealth.

18285.text: /The Lord is very great. He lives in a high place./_He fills Jerusalem with fairness and justice.

18286.text: /The Lord will be your safety./_He is full of salvation, wisdom and knowledge./_Respect for the Lord is the greatest treasure.

18287.text: ¶See, brave men are crying out in the streets./_Those who tried to bring peace are crying loudly.

18288.text: /There is no one on the roads./_No one is walking in the paths./People have broken the agreements they made./_People refuse to believe the proof from witnesses./_No one respects other people.

18289.text: /The land is sick and dying./_Lebanon is ashamed and dying./The Plain of Sharon is dry like the desert./_The trees of Bashan and Carmel are dying.

18290.text: ¶The Lord says, “Now, I will stand up/_and show my greatness./_Now, I will become important to the people.

18291.text: /You people do useless things./_These things are like hay and straw./_A destructive wind will burn you like fire.

18292.text: /People will be burned until their bones become like lime./_They will burn quickly like dry thornbushes.”

18293.text: ¶You people in faraway lands, hear what I have done./_You people who are near me, learn about my power.

18294.text: /The sinners in Jerusalem are afraid./_The people who are separated from God shake with fear./They say, “Can any of us live through this fire that destroys?/_Who can live near this fire that burns on and on?”

18295.text: /A person might do what is right./_He might speak what is right./He might refuse to take money unfairly./_He might refuse to take money to hurt others./He might not listen to plans of murder./_He might refuse to think about evil.

18296.text: /This is the kind of person who will be safe./_He will be protected as he would be in a high, walled city./He will always have bread,/_and he will not run out of water.

18297.text: /Your eyes will see the king in his beauty./_You will see the land that stretches far away.

18298.text: /You will think about the terror of the past./_You will think, “Where is that officer?/_Where is the one who collected the taxes?/_Where is the officer in charge of our defense towers?”

18299.text: /You will not see those proud people from other countries anymore./_No more will you hear their strange language/_that you couldn’t understand.

18300.text: §¶Look at Jerusalem, the city of our festivals./_Look at Jerusalem, that beautiful place of rest./It is like a tent that will never be moved./_The pegs that hold her in place will never be moved./_Her ropes will never be broken.

18301.text: /There the Lord will be our Mighty One./_That land is a place with streams and wide rivers./But there will be no enemy boats on those rivers./_No powerful ship will sail on those rivers.

18302.text: /This is because the Lord is our judge./_The Lord makes our laws./The Lord is our king./_He will save us.

18303.text: /You sailors from other lands, hear:/_The ropes on your boats hang loose./_The mast is not held firm./_The sails are not spread open./The Lord will give us your wealth./_There will be so much wealth even the crippled people will carry off a share.

18304.text: /No one living in Jerusalem will say, “I am sick.”/_The people who live there will have their sins forgiven.

18305.text: §¶All you nations, come near and listen./_Pay attention, you peoples!/The earth and all the people in it should listen./_The world and everything in it should listen.

18306.text: /The Lord is angry with all the nations./_He is angry with their armies./He will destroy them and kill them all.

18307.text: /Their bodies will be thrown outside./_The stink will rise from the bodies,/_and the blood will flow down the mountains.

18308.text: /The sun, moon and stars will dissolve./_The sky will be rolled up like a scroll./The stars will fall/_like dead leaves from a vine/_or dried‐up figs from a fig tree.

18309.text: /The Lord’s sword in the sky is covered with blood./_It will cut through Edom./_He will destroy these people as an offering to the Lord.

18310.text: /The Lord’s sword will be covered with blood./_It will be covered with fat./It is the blood from lambs and goats./_It is the fat from the kidneys of male sheep./This is because the Lord decided there will be a sacrifice in Bozrah./_He has decided there will be much killing in Edom.

18311.text: /The oxen will be killed./_And the cattle and the strong bulls will be killed./The land will be filled with their blood./_The dirt will be covered with their fat.

18312.text: ¶The Lord has chosen a time for punishment./_He has chosen a year when people must pay for the wrongs they did to Jerusalem.

18313.text: /Edom’s rivers will be like hot tar./_The dirt of Edom will be like burning sulfur./_The land of Edom will be like burning tar.

18314.text: /The fires will burn night and day./_The smoke will rise from Edom forever./Year after year that land will be empty./_No one will ever travel through that land again.

18315.text: /Birds and small animals will own that land./_Owls and ravens will live there./God will make it an empty wasteland./_It will have nothing left in it.

18316.text: /The important men will have no one left to rule them./_The leaders will all be gone.

18317.text: /Thorns will take over the strong towers./_Wild bushes will grow in the walled cities./Wild dogs will live there./_Owls will live in those homes.

18318.text: /Desert animals will live with the hyenas there./_And wild goats will call to their friends./Night animals will live there./_They will find a place of rest there.

18319.text: /Owls will nest there and lay eggs./_When the eggs open, the owls will gather their young under their wings./Hawks will gather/_with their own kind.

18320.text: ¶Look at the Lord’s scroll. Read what is written there:¶▼None of these will be missing./_Every one will have its mate./God said he will gather them together./_So his Spirit will gather them together.

18321.text: /God has divided the land among them./_And he has given them each their land./So they will own that land forever./_They will live there year after year.

18322.text: §¶The desert and dry land will become happy./_The desert will be glad and will produce flowers./Like a flower,

18323.text: /it will have many blooms./_It will show its happiness, as if it is shouting with joy./It will be beautiful like the forest of Lebanon./_It will be as beautiful as the hill of Carmel and the Plain of Sharon./All people will see the glory of the Lord./_They will see the splendor of our God.

18324.text: ¶Make the weak hands strong./_Make the weak knees strong.

18325.text: /Say to people who are afraid and confused,/_“Be strong. Don’t be afraid./Look, your God will come,/_and he will punish your enemies./He will make them pay for the wrongs they did./_He will come and save you.”

18326.text: ¶Then the blind people will see again./_Then the deaf will hear.

18327.text: /Crippled people will jump like deer./_And those who can’t talk now will shout with joy./Springs of water will flow in the desert./_Streams will flow in the dry land.

18328.text: /The burning desert will have pools of water./_The dry ground will have springs./Where wild dogs once lived,/_grass and water plants will grow.

18329.text: /A road will be there./_This highway will be called “The Road to Being Holy.”/Evil people will not be allowed to walk on that road./_Only good people will walk on that road./_No fools will go on it.

18330.text: /No lions will be there./_No dangerous animals will be on that road./_They will not be found there./That road will be for the people God saves.

18331.text: /_The people the Lord has freed will return there./They will enter Jerusalem with joy./_Their happiness will last forever./Their gladness and joy will fill them completely./_Sorrow and sadness will go far away.

18332.text: §¶During Hezekiah’s fourteenth year as king, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked Judah. He attacked all the strong, walled cities of Judah and defeated them.

18333.text: The king of Assyria sent out his field commander. He went with a large army from Lachish to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem. When the commander came near the waterway from the upper pool, he stopped. The upper pool is on the road to the Washerman’s Field.

18334.text: Eliakim, Shebna and Joah went out to meet him. Eliakim son of Hilkiah was the palace manager. Shebna was the royal assistant. And Joah son of Asaph was the recorder.

18335.text: ¶The field commander said to them, “Tell Hezekiah this:¶“‘The great king, the king of Assyria, says: You have nothing to trust in to help you.

18336.text: You say you have battle plans and power for war. But your words mean nothing. Whom are you trusting for help so that you turn against me?

18337.text: Look, you are depending on Egypt to help you. Egypt is like a splintered walking stick. If you lean on it for help, it will stab you and hurt you. The king of Egypt will hurt those who depend on him.

18338.text: You might say, “We are depending on the Lord our God.” But Hezekiah destroyed the Lord’s altars and the places of worship. Hezekiah told Judah and Jerusalem, “You must worship only at this one altar.”

18339.text: ¶“‘Now make an agreement with my master, the king of Assyria: I will give you 2,000 horses if you can find enough men to ride them.

18340.text: You cannot defeat one of my master’s least important officers. So why do you depend on Egypt to give you chariots and horsemen?

18341.text: I have not come to attack and destroy this country without an order from the Lord. The Lord himself told me to come to this country and destroy it.’”

18342.text: ¶Then Eliakim, Shebna and Joah spoke to the field commander. They said, “Please speak to us in the Aramaic language. We understand it. Don’t speak to us in Hebrew because the people on the city wall can hear you.”

18343.text: ¶But the commander said, “No. My master did not send me to tell these things only to you and your king. My master sent me to tell them also to those people sitting on the wall. They will have to eat their own dung and drink their own urine like you.”

18344.text: ¶Then the commander stood and shouted loudly in the Hebrew language. He said, “Listen to the words from the great king, the king of Assyria!

18345.text: The king says you should not let Hezekiah fool you. Hezekiah can’t save you.

18346.text: Don’t let Hezekiah talk you into trusting the Lord. Hezekiah says, ‘The Lord will surely save us. This city won’t be given over to the king of Assyria.’

18347.text: ¶“Don’t listen to Hezekiah. The king of Assyria says, ‘Make peace with me. Come out of the city to me. Then everyone will be free to eat the fruit from his own grapevine and fig tree. Everyone will be free to drink water from his own well.

18348.text: Then I will come and take you to a land like your own. It is a land with grain and new wine. It has bread and vineyards.’

18349.text: ¶“Don’t let Hezekiah fool you. He says, ‘The Lord will save us.’ The god of any other nation has not saved his people from the power of the king of Assyria.

18350.text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? They did not save Samaria from my power.

18351.text: Not one of all the gods of these countries has saved his people from me. Then the Lord cannot save Jerusalem from my power.”

18352.text: ¶The people were silent. They didn’t answer the commander at all. This was because King Hezekiah had ordered, “Don’t answer him.”

18353.text: ¶Then Eliakim, Shebna and Joah tore their clothes to show how upset they were. (Eliakim son of Hilkiah was the palace manager. Shebna was the royal assistant. And Joah son of Asaph was the recorder.) The three men went to Hezekiah and told him what the field commander had said.

18354.text: §¶When King Hezekiah heard the message, he tore his clothes. And he put on rough cloth to show how sad he was. Then he went into the Temple of the Lord.

18355.text: Hezekiah sent Eliakim, Shebna and the older priests to Isaiah. Eliakim was the palace manager, and Shebna was the royal assistant. The men were all wearing the rough cloth when they came to Isaiah. He was a prophet, the son of Amoz.

18356.text: These men told Isaiah, “This is what Hezekiah says: Today is a day of sorrow and punishment and disgrace. It is sad, as when a child should be born, but the mother is not strong enough to give birth to it.

18357.text: The king of Assyria sent his field commander to make fun of the living God. Maybe the Lord your God will hear what the commander said. Maybe the Lord your God will punish him for what he said. So pray for the few people of Israel who are left alive.”

18359.text: he said to them, “Tell your master this: The Lord says, ‘Don’t be afraid of what you have heard. Don’t be frightened by the words the servants of the king of Assyria said against me.

18360.text: Listen! I am going to put a spirit in the king of Assyria. He will hear a report that will make him return to his own country. And I will cause him to die by the sword there.’”

18361.text: ¶The field commander heard that the king of Assyria had left Lachish. So the commander left and found the king fighting against the city of Libnah.

18362.text: ¶The king received a report that Tirhakah was coming to attack him. Tirhakah was the Cushite king of Egypt. When the king of Assyria heard this, he sent messengers to Hezekiah. The king said:

18363.text: “Say this to Hezekiah king of Judah: Don’t be fooled by the god you trust. Don’t believe him when he says Jerusalem will not be defeated by the king of Assyria.

18364.text: You have heard what the kings of Assyria have done. They have completely defeated every country. Do not think you will be saved.

18365.text: The gods of those people did not save them. My ancestors destroyed them. My ancestors defeated the cities of Gozan, Haran and Rezeph. They defeated the people of Eden living in Tel Assar.

18366.text: Where are the kings of Hamath and Arpad? Where is the king of the city of Sepharvaim? Where are the kings of Hena and Ivvah?”

18367.text: §¶Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers and read it. Then he went up to the Temple of the Lord. Hezekiah spread the letter out before the Lord.

18368.text: And he prayed to the Lord:

18369.text: “Lord of heaven’s armies, you are the God of Israel. Your throne is between the gold creatures with wings. Only you are the God of all the kingdoms of the earth. You made the heavens and the earth.

18370.text: Hear, Lord, and listen. Open your eyes, Lord, and see. Listen to all the words Sennacherib has said to insult the living God.

18371.text: ¶“It is true, Lord. The kings of Assyria have destroyed all these countries and their lands.

18372.text: These kings have thrown the gods of these nations into the fire. But they were only wood and rock statues that men made. So the kings have destroyed them.

18373.text: Now, Lord our God, save us from the king’s power. Then all the kingdoms of the earth will know that you, Lord, are the only God.”

18374.text: §¶Then Isaiah son of Amoz sent a message to Hezekiah. Isaiah said, “The Lord, the God of Israel, says this: ‘You prayed to me about Sennacherib king of Assyria.

18375.text: So this is what the Lord has said against Sennacherib:¶▼The people of Jerusalem/_hate you and make fun of you./The people of Jerusalem/_laugh at you as you run away.

18376.text: /You have insulted me and spoken against me./_You have raised your voice against me./You have a proud look on your face./_You disobey me, the Holy One of Israel!

18377.text: /You have used your messengers to insult the Lord./_You have said, “I have many chariots./With them I have gone to the tops of the mountains./_I have climbed the highest mountains of Lebanon./I have cut down its tallest cedars./_I have cut down its best pine trees./I have gone to its greatest heights./_I have gone to its best forests.

18378.text: /I have dug wells in foreign countries./_I have drunk water there./By the soles of my feet,/_I have dried up all the rivers of Egypt.”

18379.text: ¶“‘King of Assyria, surely you have heard./_Long ago I, the Lord, planned these things./Long ago I planned them./_Now I have made them happen./I allowed you to turn those strong, walled cities/_into piles of rocks.

18380.text: /The people living in those cities were weak./_They were frightened and put to shame./They were like grass in the field./_They were like tender, young grass./They were like grass that grows on the housetop./_It is burned by the wind before it can grow.

18381.text: ¶“‘I know when you rest and when you come and go./_I know how you speak against me.

18382.text: /You speak strongly against me./_And I have heard your proud words./So I will put my hook in your nose./_And I will put my bit in your mouth./Then I will force you to leave my country/_the same way that you came.’

18383.text: ¶“Then the Lord said, ‘Hezekiah, I will give you this sign:¶▼This year you will eat the grain that grows wild./_And the second year you will eat what grows wild from that./But in the third year, plant grain and harvest it./_Plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

18384.text: /The people left alive in the family of Judah/_will be saved./Like plants that take root,/_they will grow strong and have many children.

18385.text: /A few people will come out of Jerusalem alive./_There will be a few from Mount Zion who will live./The strong love of the Lord of heaven’s armies/_will cause this to happen.’

18386.text: ¶“So this is what the Lord says about the king of Assyria:¶▼‘He will not enter this city./_He will not even shoot an arrow here./He will not fight against it with shields./_He will not build a ramp to attack the city walls.

18387.text: /He will return to his country the same way he came./_He will not enter this city,’/_says the Lord.

18388.text: /The Lord says, ‘I will defend and save this city./_I will do this for myself and for David, my servant.’”

18389.text: ¶Then the angel of the Lord went out. He killed 185,000 men in the Assyrian camp. When the people got up early the next morning, they saw all the dead bodies!

18390.text: So Sennacherib king of Assyria left. He went back to Nineveh and stayed there.

18391.text: ¶One day Sennacherib was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch. While he was there, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer killed him with a sword. Then they escaped to the land of Ararat. So Sennacherib’s son Esarhaddon became king of Assyria.

18392.text: §¶At that time Hezekiah became very sick. He was almost dead. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz went to see him. Isaiah told him, “This is what the Lord says: You are going to die. So you should give your last orders to everyone. You will not get well.”

18393.text: ¶Hezekiah turned toward the wall and prayed to the Lord.

18394.text: He said, “Lord, please remember that I have always obeyed you. I have given myself completely to you. I have done what you said was right.” And Hezekiah cried loudly.

18395.text: ¶Then the Lord spoke his word to Isaiah:

18396.text: “Go to Hezekiah and tell him: ‘This is what the Lord, the God of your ancestor David, says: I have heard your prayer. And I have seen your tears. I will add 15 years to your life.

18397.text: I will save you and this city from the king of Assyria. I will defend this city.’”

18398.text: ¶Isaiah said, “The Lord will do what he says. This is the sign from the Lord to show you:

18399.text: The sun has made a shadow go down the stairway of Ahaz. I will make it go back ten steps.” So the shadow made by the sun went back up the ten steps it had gone down.

18400.text: ¶After Hezekiah king of Judah got well, he wrote this song:

18401.text: ¶I said, “I am in the middle of my life./_Do I have to go through the gates where the dead are now?/_Will I have the rest of my life taken away from me?”

18402.text: /I said, “I will not see the Lord/_in the land of the living again./I will not again see the people/_who live on the earth.

18403.text: /Like a shepherd’s tent,/_my home has been pulled down and taken from me./I am finished like the cloth/_a weaver rolls up and cuts from the loom./_In one day you brought me to this end.

18404.text: /All night I cried loudly./_Like a lion, he crushed all my bones./_In one day you brought me to this end.

18405.text: /I cried like a bird./_I moaned like a dove./My eyes became tired as I looked to the heavens./_Lord, I have troubles. Please help me.”

18406.text: ¶What can I say?/_The Lord told me what would happen and then made it happen./I have had these troubles in my soul./_So now I will be humble all my life.

18407.text: /Lord, because of you, men live./_Because of you, my spirit also lives./You made me well and let me live.

18408.text: /It was for my own good/_that I had such troubles./Because you love me very much,/_you did not let me die./You threw my sins/_far away.

18409.text: /People in the place where the dead are cannot praise you./_Those who have died cannot sing praises to you./Those who die don’t trust you/_to help them.

18410.text: /The people who are alive are the ones who praise you./_They praise you as I praise you today./A father should tell his children/_that you provide help.

18411.text: ¶The Lord saved me./_So we will sing and play songs./We will make music in the Temple of the Lord/_all the days of our lives.

18412.text: ¶Then Isaiah said, “Make a paste from figs. Put it on Hezekiah’s boil. Then he will get well.”

18413.text: ¶Hezekiah asked Isaiah, “What will be the sign? What will show that I will go up to the Temple of the Lord?”

18414.text: §¶At that time Merodach‐Baladan son of Baladan was king of Babylon. He sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah. He did this because he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick and was now well.

18415.text: Hezekiah was happy to see the messengers. So he showed them what was in his storehouses: the silver, gold, spices and expensive perfumes. He showed them his swords and shields. He showed them all his wealth. He showed them everything in his palace and in his kingdom.

18416.text: ¶Then Isaiah the prophet went to King Hezekiah. He asked Hezekiah, “What did these men say? Where did they come from?”¶Hezekiah said, “They came from a faraway country. They came to me from Babylon.”

18417.text: ¶So Isaiah asked him, “What did they see in your palace?”¶Hezekiah said, “They saw everything in my palace. I showed them all my wealth.”

18418.text: ¶Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah: “Listen to the words of the Lord of heaven’s armies:

18419.text: ‘In the future everything in your palace will be taken away to Babylon. Everything your ancestors have stored up until this day will be taken away. Nothing will be left,’ says the Lord.

18420.text: Some of your own children will be taken away. Those who will be born to you will be taken away. And they will become eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”

18421.text: ¶Hezekiah told Isaiah, “These words from the Lord are good.” He said this because he thought, “There will be peace and security while I am king.”

18423.text: /Speak kindly to the people of Jerusalem./_Tell them/that their time of service is finished./_Tell them that they have paid for their sins./Tell them that the Lord has punished Jerusalem/_twice for every sin they did.”

18424.text: ¶This is the voice of a man who calls out:/“Prepare in the desert/_the way for the Lord./Make the road in the dry lands/_straight for our God.

18425.text: /Every valley should be raised up./_Every mountain and hill should be made flat./The rough ground should be made level./_The rugged ground should be made smooth.

18426.text: /Then the glory of the Lord will be shown./_All people together will see it./The Lord himself said these things.”

18427.text: ¶A voice says, “Cry out!”/_Then I said, “What shall I cry out?”¶“Say all people are like the grass./_And all their strength is like the flowers of the field.

18428.text: /The grass dies, and the flowers fall./_This is because the breath of the Lord blows on them./_Surely the people are like grass.

18429.text: /The grass dies, and the flowers fall./_But the word of our God will live forever.”

18430.text: /Jerusalem, you have good news to tell./_Go up on a high mountain./Jerusalem, you have good news to tell./_Shout out loud the good news./Shout it out and don’t be afraid./_Say to the towns of Judah,/_“Here is your God.”

18431.text: /Look, the Lord God is coming with power./_He will use his power to rule all the people./Look, he will bring reward for his people./_He will have their payment with him.

18432.text: /The Lord takes care of his people like a shepherd./_He gathers the people like lambs in his arms./_He carries them close to him./He gently leads the mothers of the lambs.

18433.text: §¶Who has measured the oceans in the palm of his hand?/_Who has used his hand to measure the sky?/Who has used a bowl to measure all the dust of the earth?/_Who has used scales to weigh the mountains and hills?

18434.text: /Who has known the mind of the Lord?/_Who has been able to give the Lord advice?

18435.text: /Whom did the Lord ask for help?/_Who taught him the right way?/Who taught the Lord knowledge?/_Who showed him the way to understanding?

18436.text: ¶The nations are like one small drop in a bucket./_They are no more than the dust on his measuring scales./_To him the islands are no more than fine dust on his scales.

18437.text: /All the trees in Lebanon are not enough for the altar fires./_And all the animals in Lebanon are not enough for burnt offerings.

18438.text: /Compared to the Lord all the nations are worth nothing./_To him they are less than nothing.

18439.text: ¶Can you compare God to anything?/_Can you compare him to an image of anything?

18440.text: /An idol is formed by a man./_And another man covers it with gold./_And he makes silver chains for it.

18441.text: /A poor man cannot buy those expensive statues./_So he finds a tree that will not rot./And he finds a skilled workman/_to make it into an idol that will not fall over.

18442.text: ¶Surely you know. Surely you have heard./_Surely in the beginning someone told you./_Surely you understand how the earth was created.

18443.text: /God sits on his throne above the circle of the earth./_And compared to him, people are like grasshoppers./He stretches out the skies like a piece of cloth./_He spreads them out like a tent to sit under.

18444.text: /He makes rulers unimportant./_He makes the judges of this world worth nothing.

18445.text: /They are like plants that are placed in the ground./_They are like seeds that are planted./As soon as they begin to grow strong,/_he blows on them and they die./_The wind blows them away like chaff.

18446.text: ¶God, the Holy One, says, “Can you compare me to anyone?/_Is anyone equal to me?”

18447.text: /Look up to the skies./_Who created all these stars?/He leads out all the army of heaven one by one./_He calls all the stars by name./He is very strong and full of power./_So not one of them is missing.

18448.text: ¶People of Jacob, why do you complain?/_People of Israel, why do you say,/“The Lord does not see what happens to me./_He does not care if I am treated fairly”?

18449.text: /Surely you know./_Surely you have heard./The Lord is the God who lives forever./_He created all the world./He does not become tired or need to rest./_No one can understand how great his wisdom is.

18450.text: /The Lord gives strength to those who are tired./_He gives more power to those who are weak.

18451.text: /Even boys become tired and need to rest./_Even young men trip and fall.

18452.text: /But the people who trust the Lord will become strong again./They will be able to rise up as an eagle in the sky./_They will run without needing rest./_They will walk without becoming tired.

18453.text: §¶The Lord says, “Faraway countries, listen to me./_Let the nations become strong./Come to me and speak./_We will meet together to decide who is right.

18454.text: ¶“Who caused the man to come from the east?/_Who gives the man victories everywhere he goes?/The one who brought him gives nations over to him./_He defeats kings for him./The man uses his sword, and the kings become like dust./_He uses his bow, and they are blown away like chaff.

18455.text: /He chases them and is never hurt./_He goes places where he has never been before.

18456.text: /Who caused this to happen?/_Who has controlled history since the beginning?/I, the Lord, am the one. I was here at the beginning./_And I will be here when all things are finished.”

18457.text: ¶All you faraway places, look and be afraid./_All you places far away on the earth, shake with fear./Come close and listen to me.

18458.text: /_The workers help each other./_They say to each other, “Be strong!”

18459.text: /The man who carves wood encourages the man who works with gold./_The workman who smooths the metal with a hammer encourages the man who shapes the metal./This last workman says, “This metal work is good.”/_He nails the statue to a base so it can’t fall over.

18460.text: §¶The Lord says, “People of Israel, you are my servants./_People of Jacob, I chose you./You are from the family of my friend Abraham.

18461.text: /You were far away on the earth./_I called you from a faraway country./I said, ‘You are my servants.’/_I have chosen you, and I have not turned against you.

18462.text: /So don’t worry, because I am with you./_Don’t be afraid, because I am your God./I will make you strong and will help you./_I will support you with my right hand that saves you.

18463.text: ¶“All those people who are angry with you/_will be ashamed and disgraced./Those who are against you/_will disappear and be lost.

18464.text: /You will look for your enemies./_But you will not find them./Those who fought against you/_will vanish completely.

18465.text: /I am the Lord your God./_I am holding your right hand./And I tell you, ‘Don’t be afraid./_I will help you.’

18466.text: /You few people of Israel who are left,/_do not be afraid even though you are weak as a worm./I myself will help you,” says the Lord./_“I am the one who saves you, the Holy One of Israel.

18467.text: /Look, I have made you like a threshing board./_You are new, with many sharp teeth./So you will walk on mountains and crush them./_You will make the hills like chaff.

18468.text: /You will throw them into the air. And the wind will carry them away./_A windstorm will scatter them./Then you will be happy in the Lord./_You will be proud of the Holy One of Israel.

18469.text: ¶“The poor and needy people look for water./_But they can’t find any./_Their tongues are dry with thirst./But I, the Lord, will answer their prayers./_I, the God of Israel, will not leave them to die.

18470.text: /I will make rivers flow on the dry hills./_I will make springs of water flow through the valleys./I will change the desert into a lake of water./_I will change the dry land into springs of water.

18471.text: /I will make trees grow in the desert./_There will be cedars, acacia, myrtle and olive trees./I will put pine, fir and cypress trees/_growing together in the desert.

18472.text: /People will see these things and understand./_Together they will think carefully about these things./They will know that the Lord’s power did this./_They will know that the Holy One of Israel made these things.”

18473.text: §¶The Lord says, “Present your case.”/_The Lord, the King of Jacob, says, “Tell me your arguments.

18474.text: /Bring in your idols to tell us/_what is going to happen./Have them tell us what happened in the beginning./_Then we will think about these things./_Then we will know how they will turn out./Tell us what will happen in the future.

18475.text: /_Tell us what is coming next./_Then we will believe that you are gods./Do something, whether it is good or bad./_Make us afraid of you.

18476.text: /You false gods are less than nothing./_You can’t do anything./_Those who worship you should be hated.”

18477.text: ¶“I have brought someone to come out of the north./_I have called by name a man from the east, and he knows me./He walks on kings as if they were mud./_He walks on them as a potter walks on the clay.

18478.text: /Who told us about this before it happened?/_Who told us ahead of time so we could say, ‘He was right’?/None of you told us anything./_None of you told us before it happened./_No one heard you tell about it.

18479.text: /I, the Lord, was the first one to tell Jerusalem that the people were coming home./_I sent a messenger to Jerusalem with the good news.

18480.text: /I look at the idols, but there is not one that can answer./_None of them can give advice./_None of them can answer my questions.

18481.text: /Look, all these idols are false gods./_They cannot do anything./_They are worth nothing.

18482.text: §¶“Here is my servant, the one I support./_He is the one I chose, and I am pleased with him./I will put my Spirit in him./_And he will bring justice to all nations.

18483.text: /He will not cry out or yell./_He will not speak loudly in the streets.

18484.text: /He will not break a crushed blade of grass./_He will not put out even a weak flame./He will bring justice and find what is true.

18485.text: /_He will not lose hope or give up/until he brings justice to the world./_And people far away will trust his teachings.”

18486.text: ¶God, the Lord, said these things./He created the skies and stretched them out./_He spread out the earth and everything on it./He gives life to all people on earth./_He gives life to everyone who walks on the earth.

18487.text: /The Lord says, “I called you to do right./_And I will hold your hand./I will protect you./_You will be the sign of my agreement with the people./_You will be a light to shine for all people.

18488.text: /You will help the blind to see./_You will free those who are in prison./_You will lead those who live in darkness out of their prison.

18489.text: ¶“I am the Lord. That is my name./_I will not give my glory to another./_I will not let idols take the praise that should be mine.

18490.text: /The things I said would happen have happened./_And now I tell you about new things./Before those things happen,/_I tell you about them.”

18491.text: §¶Sing a new song to the Lord./_Sing his praise everywhere on the earth./Praise him, you people who sail on the seas and you animals who live in them./_Praise him, you people living in faraway places.

18492.text: /The deserts and their cities should praise him./_The settlements of Kedar should praise him./The people living in Sela should sing for joy./_They should sing from the mountaintops.

18493.text: /They should give glory to the Lord./_People in faraway lands should praise him.

18494.text: /The Lord will march out like a strong soldier./_He will be excited like a man ready to fight a war./He will shout out the battle cry./_And he will defeat his enemies.

18495.text: ¶The Lord says, “For a long time I have said nothing./_I have been quiet and held myself back./But now I will cry out./_I will strain like a woman giving birth to a child.

18496.text: /I will destroy the hills and mountains./_I will dry up all the plants that grow there./I will make the rivers become dry land./_I will dry up the pools of water.

18497.text: /Then I will lead the blind along a way they never knew./_I will guide them along paths they have not known./I will make the darkness become light for them./_And I will make the rough ground smooth./These are the things I will do./_I will not leave my people.

18498.text: /But some people trust in idols./_They say to their statues,/‘You are our gods.’/_Those people will be rejected in disgrace.

18499.text: §¶“You who are deaf, hear me./_You who are blind, look and see.

18500.text: /No one is more blind than my servant Israel./_The messenger I send is the most deaf./No one is more blind than the person I own./_No one is more blind than the servant of the Lord.

18501.text: /Israel, you have seen much, but you have not obeyed./_You have heard, but you refuse to listen.”

18502.text: /The Lord made his teachings wonderful./_He did this because he is good.

18503.text: /These people have been defeated and robbed./_They are trapped in pits./_They are locked up in prison./Like robbers, enemies have taken them away./_There is no one to save them./Enemies carried them off./_And no one said, “Bring them back.”

18504.text: ¶Will any of you listen to this?/_Will you listen carefully in the future?

18505.text: /Who let the people of Jacob be carried off?/_Who let robbers take Israel away?/The Lord allowed this to happen/_because we sinned against him./We did not live the way the Lord wanted us to live./_We did not obey his teaching.

18506.text: /So the Lord became very angry with us./_He brought terrible wars against us./It was as if the people of Israel had fire all around them./_But they didn’t know what was happening./It was as if they were burning./_But they didn’t pay any attention.

18507.text: §¶Now this is what the Lord says./_He created you, people of Jacob./_He formed you, people of Israel./He says, “Don’t be afraid, because I have saved you./_I have called you by name, and you are mine.

18508.text: /When you pass through the waters, I will be with you./_When you cross rivers, you will not drown./When you walk through fire, you will not be burned./_The flames will not hurt you.

18509.text: /This is because I, the Lord, am your God./_I, the Holy One of Israel, am your Savior./I gave Egypt to pay for you./_I gave Cush and Seba to make you mine.

18510.text: /You are precious to me./_I give you honor, and I love you./So I will give other people in your place./_I will give other nations to save your life.

18511.text: /So don’t be afraid. I am with you./_I will gather your children from the east./_I will gather you from the west.

18512.text: /I will tell the north: Give my people to me./_I will tell the south: Don’t keep my people in prison./Bring my sons from far away./_Bring my daughters from faraway places.

18513.text: /Bring to me all the people who are mine./_I made them for my glory./_I formed them; I made them.”

18514.text: §¶Bring out the people who have eyes but don’t see./_Bring out those who have ears but don’t hear.

18515.text: /All the nations should gather together./_All the people should come together./Which of their gods said that this would happen?/_Which of their gods can tell what happened in the beginning?/They should bring their witnesses to prove they were right./_Then others will say, “It is true.”

18516.text: /The Lord says, “You are my witnesses./_You are the servant I chose./I chose you so you would know and believe me./_I chose you so you would understand that I am the true God./There was no God before me,/_and there will be no God after me.

18517.text: /I myself am the Lord./_I am the only Savior.

18518.text: /I myself have spoken to you, saved you and told you these things./_It was not some foreign god among you./You are my witnesses, and I am God,”/_says the Lord.

18519.text: /_“I have always been God./No one can save people from my power./_When I do something, no one can change it.”

18520.text: ¶This is what the Lord says./_He is the Holy One of Israel who saves you./He says, “I will send armies to Babylon for you./_All the Babylonians will be captured./They will be taken away in their ships they are proud of.

18521.text: /I am the Lord, your Holy One./_I made Israel. I am your king.”

18522.text: §¶This is what the Lord says./_He is the one who made a road through the sea./_Even through rough waters he made a path for his people.

18523.text: /He is the one who defeated the chariots and horses./_He defeated the mighty armies./They fell together, and they will never rise again./_They were destroyed as a flame is put out.

18524.text: /The Lord says, “Forget what happened before./_Do not think about the past.

18525.text: /Look at the new thing I am going to do./_It is already happening. Don’t you see it?/I will make a road in the desert./_I will make rivers in the dry land.

18526.text: /Even the wild animals will be thankful to me./_The wild dogs and owls will honor me./They will honor me when I put water in the desert./_They will honor me when I make rivers in the dry land./I will do this to give water to my people, the ones I chose.

18527.text: /These are the people I made./_And they will sing songs to praise me.

18528.text: ¶“People of Jacob, you have not called to me./_People of Israel, you have become tired of me.

18529.text: /You have not brought your sacrifices of sheep to me./_You have not honored me by bringing sacrifices to me./I did not force you to give sacrifices to me./_I did not force you to burn incense until you became tired.

18530.text: /So you did not buy incense for me./_You did not freely bring fat from your sacrifices to me./Instead you have weighed me down with your many sins./_You have made me tired of your many wrongs.

18531.text: ¶“I, I am the One who forgives all your sins./_I do this to please myself./_I will not remember your sins.

18532.text: /But you should remind me./_Let’s meet and decide what is right./_Tell what you have done and show you are right.

18533.text: /Your first father sinned./_And your leaders have turned against me.

18534.text: /So I will make your holy rulers not holy./_And I will bring destruction on the people of Jacob./_And I will let Israel be insulted.”

18535.text: §¶The Lord says, “People of Jacob, you are my servants. Listen to me!/_People of Israel, I chose you.”

18536.text: /This is what the Lord says. He made you./_He formed you when you were in your mother’s body./_And he will help you./The Lord says, “People of Jacob, my servants, don’t be afraid./_Israel, I chose you.

18537.text: /I will pour out water for the thirsty land./_I will make streams flow on dry land./I will put my Spirit into your children./_My blessing will be like a stream of water flowing over your family.

18538.text: /Your children will grow like a tree in the grass./_They will be like poplar trees growing beside streams of water.

18539.text: /One person will say, ‘I belong to the Lord.’/_Another will use the name Jacob./Another will sign his name ‘I am the Lord’s.’/_And another will use the name Israel.”

18540.text: ¶The Lord is the king of Israel./_The Lord of heaven’s armies saves Israel./The Lord says, “I am the beginning and the end./_I am the only God.

18541.text: /There is no other God like me./_If there is, then that god should come and prove it./Who has announced coming events from the beginning?/_He should tell what will happen in the future.

18542.text: /Don’t be afraid! Don’t worry!/_I have always told you what will happen./You are my witnesses./_There is no other God./_I know of no other Rock. I am the only One.”

18543.text: §¶Some people make idols, but they are worth nothing./_People love them, but they are useless./Those people are witnesses for the statues. But those people cannot see./_They know nothing. They don’t know enough to be ashamed.

18544.text: /Who made these false gods?/_Who made these useless idols?

18545.text: /The workmen who made those gods will be ashamed!/_Those workmen are only human./If they all would come together,/_they would all be ashamed and afraid.

18546.text: ¶One workman uses tools to heat iron./_He works over hot coals./He uses his hammer to beat the metal and make a statue./_He uses his powerful arms./But when he becomes hungry, he loses his power./_If he does not drink water, he becomes tired.

18547.text: ¶Another workman uses a line and a compass/_to draw lines on the wood./Then he uses his chisels to cut a statue from wood./_He uses his calipers to measure the statue./This way, the workman makes the wood look exactly like a man./_And this statue of a man sits in the house.

18548.text: /A man cuts down cedar/_or gets cypress or oak trees./Those trees grew by their own power in the forest./_Or he plants a pine tree, and the rain makes it grow.

18549.text: /Then he burns the tree./_He uses some of the wood for a fire to keep himself warm./_He also starts a fire to bake his bread./But he uses part of the wood to make a god. Then he worships it!/_He makes the idol and bows down to it!

18550.text: /The man burns half of the wood in the fire./_He uses the fire to cook his meat./_And he eats the meat until he is full./He burns the wood to keep himself warm. He says,/_“Good! Now I am warm. I can see because of the fire’s light.”

18551.text: /But the man makes a statue from the wood that is left. He calls it his god./_He bows down to it and worships it./He prays to it and says,/_“You are my god. Save me!”

18552.text: /Those people don’t know what they are doing. They don’t understand!/_It is as if their eyes are covered so they can’t see./_Their minds don’t understand.

18553.text: /They have not thought about these things./_They don’t understand./They have never thought to themselves,/_“I burned half of the wood in the fire./_I used the hot coals to bake my bread./_I cooked and ate my meat./And I used the wood that was left to make this hated thing./_I am worshiping a block of wood!”

18554.text: /He doesn’t know what he is doing./_His confused mind leads him the wrong way./He cannot save himself./_He cannot say, “This statue I am holding is a false god.”

18555.text: §¶The Lord says, “People of Jacob, remember these things!/_People of Israel, remember you are my servants./I made you. You are my servants./_So Israel, I will not forget you.

18556.text: /I have swept away your sins like a big cloud./_I have removed your sins like a cloud that disappears into the air./Come back to me because I saved you.”

18557.text: ¶Skies, sing for joy because the Lord did great things!/_Earth, shout for joy, even in your deepest parts!/Sing, you mountains, with thanks to God./_Sing, too, you trees in the forest!/The Lord saved the people of Jacob!/_The Lord showed his greatness when he saved Israel.

18558.text: /The Lord saved you./_He formed you while you were still in your mother’s body./The Lord says, “I, the Lord, made everything!/_I alone stretched out the skies./_I spread out the earth by myself.

18559.text: /I show that the lying prophets’ signs are false./_I make fools of those who do magic./I confuse even wise men./_They think they know much, but I make them look foolish.

18560.text: /I make the messages of my servants come true./_I make the advice of my messengers come true./I say to Jerusalem,/_‘People will live in you again!’/I say to the towns of Judah,/_‘You will be built again!’/I say to Jerusalem’s ruins,/_‘I will repair you.’

18561.text: /I tell the deep waters, ‘Become dry!/_I will make your streams become dry!’

18562.text: /I say of Cyrus, ‘He is my shepherd./_He will do all that I want him to do./_He will say to Jerusalem, “You will be built again!”/_He will tell the Temple, “Your foundations will be rebuilt.”’”

18563.text: §¶This is what the Lord says to Cyrus, his appointed king:¶▼“I hold your right hand./I will help you defeat nations./_I will help you take other kings’ power away./I will open doors for you/_so city gates will not stop you.

18564.text: /I will go before you./_And I will make the mountains flat./I will break down the bronze gates of the cities./_I will cut through the iron bars on the gates.

18565.text: /I will give you the wealth that is stored away./_And I will give you hidden riches./I will do this so you will know I am the Lord./_I, the God of Israel, call you by name.

18566.text: /I do these things for my servants, the people of Jacob./_I do these things for my chosen people, the Israelites./Cyrus, I call you by name./_I give you a title of honor even though you don’t know me.

18567.text: /_I am the Lord. There is no other God./_I am the only God./I will make you strong/_even though you don’t know me.

18568.text: /I do these things so everyone will know/_there is no other God./From the east to the west they will know/_I alone am the Lord.

18569.text: /I made the light and the darkness./_I bring peace, and I cause troubles./_I, the Lord, do all these things.

18570.text: ¶“Sky above, make victory fall like rain./_Clouds, pour down victory./May the earth receive it./_May salvation grow./May victory grow with it./_I, the Lord, have created it.

18571.text: ¶“How terrible it will be for those who argue with the God who made them./_They are like one piece of broken pottery among many pieces./The clay does not ask the potter,/_‘What are you doing?’/The thing that is made doesn’t say to its maker,/_‘You have no hands.’

18572.text: /How terrible it will be for the child who says to his father,/_‘Why are you giving me life?’/How terrible it will be for the child who says to his mother,/_‘Why are you giving birth to me?’”

18573.text: ¶The Lord is the Holy One of Israel, and its Maker./_He says this:/“You ask me about what will happen./_You question me about my children./_You give me orders about what I have made.

18574.text: /I made the earth./_And I made all the people living on it./With my own hands I stretched out the skies./_I command all the armies in the sky.

18575.text: /I will bring Cyrus to do good things./_And I will make his work easy./Cyrus will rebuild my city,/_and he will set my people free./Cyrus has not been paid to do these things./_The Lord of heaven’s armies says this.”

18576.text: ¶The Lord says,/“The things made in Egypt and Cush/_and the tall people of Seba/will come to you./_They will become yours./The Sabeans will walk behind you./_They will come along in chains./They will bow down before you./_They will pray to you, saying,/‘God is with you./_And there is no other God.’”

18577.text: ¶You are a God that people cannot see./_You are the God and Savior of Israel.

18578.text: /All the people who make idols will be put to great shame./_They will go off together in disgrace.

18579.text: /But Israel will be saved by the Lord./_That salvation will continue forever./_Never again will Israel be put to shame.

18580.text: ¶The Lord created the heavens./_He is the God/_who formed the earth./_He made the earth./But he did not want it to be empty./_He wanted life to be on the earth./This is what the Lord says:/_“I am the Lord. There is no other God.

18581.text: /I did not speak in secret./_I did not hide my words somewhere in a dark place./I did not tell the family of Jacob/_to look for me in empty places./I am the Lord, and I speak the truth./_I say what is right.

18582.text: ¶“You people have escaped from other nations./_So gather together and come before me./_Come near together./People who carry idols of wood don’t know what they are doing./_They pray to a god who cannot save them.

18583.text: /Tell these people to come to me./_Let them talk about these things together./Who told you long ago that this would happen?/_Who told about it long ago?/I, the Lord, said these things./_There is no other God besides me./I am the only good God. I am the Savior./_There is no other God.

18584.text: ¶“All people everywhere,/_follow me and be saved./_I am God. There is no other God.

18585.text: /I will make a promise by my own power./_And my promise is true./_What I say will not be changed./I promise that everyone will bow before me./_Everyone will promise to follow me.

18586.text: /People will say, ‘Goodness and power/_come only from the Lord.’”/Everyone who has been angry with the Lord/_will come to him and be ashamed.

18587.text: /But with the Lord’s help, the people of Israel/_will be found to be good./_And they will praise him.

18588.text: §¶Bel and Nebo bow down./_Their idols are carried by animals./The statues are only heavy loads that must be carried./_They only make people tired.

18589.text: /These false gods will all bow down./_They cannot save themselves./_They will all be carried away like prisoners.

18590.text: ¶“Family of Jacob, listen to me!/_All you people from Israel who are still alive, listen!/I have carried you since you were born./_I have taken care of you from your birth.

18591.text: /Even when you are old, I will take care of you./_Even when your hair has turned gray, I will take care of you./I made you and will take care of you./_I will carry you, and I will save you.

18592.text: ¶“Can you compare me to anyone?/_No one is equal to me or like me.

18593.text: /Some people are rich with gold./_They weigh their silver on the scales./They hire a goldsmith, and he makes it into a god./_Then they bow down and worship it.

18594.text: /They put it on their shoulders and carry it./_They set it in its place, and there it stands./_It cannot move from its place./People may yell at it, but it cannot answer./_It cannot save people from their troubles.

18595.text: ¶“Remember this, and do not forget it!/_Think about these things, you who turn against God.

18596.text: /Remember what happened long ago./_Remember that I am God. There is no other God./_I am God. There is no one like me.

18597.text: /From the beginning I told you what would happen in the end./_A long time ago I told you things that have not yet happened./When I plan something, it happens./_I do the things I want to do.

18598.text: /I am calling a man from the east to carry out my plan./_He will come like a hawk from a country far away./I will make what I have said come true./_I will do what I have planned.

18599.text: /Listen to me, you stubborn people./_You are far from what is right.

18600.text: /I will soon do the things that are right./_I will bring salvation soon./I will save Jerusalem./_And I will bring glory to Israel.”

18601.text: §¶The Lord says, “City of Babylon,/_go down and sit in the dirt./People of Babylon, sit on the ground./_You are no longer the ruler./You will no longer be called/_tender or beautiful.

18602.text: /_You must use large stones to grind grain into flour./Remove your veil and your nice skirts./_Uncover your legs and cross the rivers.

18603.text: /Men will see your nakedness./_They will see your shame./I will punish you./_I will punish every one of you.”

18604.text: ¶Our Savior is named the Lord of heaven’s armies./_He is the Holy One of Israel.

18605.text: ¶“Babylon, sit in darkness and say nothing./_You will no longer be called the queen of kingdoms.

18606.text: /I was angry with my people./_So I rejected those people who belonged to me./I gave them to you,/_but you showed them no mercy./You even made the old people/_work very hard.

18607.text: /You said, ‘I will live forever./_I will always be the queen.’/You did not think about these things./_You did not think about what would happen.

18608.text: ¶“Now, listen, you lover of pleasure./_You think you are safe./You tell yourself,/_‘I am the only important person./I will never be a widow./_I will never lose my children.’
