18609.text: /Two things will happen to you/_suddenly in a single day./_You will lose your children and your husband./These things will truly happen to you./_All your magic and powerful tricks/_will not save you.

18610.text: /You do evil things, but you feel safe./_You say, ‘No one sees what I do.’/Your wisdom and knowledge/_have fooled you./You say to yourself,/_‘I am God. No one is equal to me.’

18611.text: /But troubles will come to you./_You will not know how to stop them./Disaster will fall on you./_And you will not be able to keep it away./You will be destroyed quickly./_You will not even see it coming.

18612.text: ¶“Keep on using your tricks./_Continue doing all your magic./_You have done these things since you were young./Maybe they will help you./_Maybe you will be able to scare someone.

18613.text: /You are tired of the advice you have received./_So let those who study the sky come./They tell the future by looking at the stars./_So let them save you from what is about to happen to you.

18614.text: /But they are like straw./_Fire will quickly burn them up./They cannot save themselves/_from the power of the fire./They are not like coals that give warmth./_They are not like a fire you may sit beside.

18615.text: /You have worked with these people./_They have been with you since you were young./_But they will not be able to help you./Everyone will go his own way./_And there will be no one left to save you.”

18616.text: §¶The Lord says, “Family of Jacob, listen to me./_You are called Israel./_You come from the family of Judah./You use the Lord’s name to make promises./_You praise the God of Israel,/_but you are not honest or sincere.

18617.text: /You call yourselves people of the holy city./_You depend on the God of Israel./_He is named the Lord of heaven’s armies.

18618.text: /Long ago I told you what would happen./_I said these things and made them known./_Suddenly I acted, and these things happened.

18619.text: /I did that because I knew you were stubborn./_Your neck was like an iron muscle./_It was as if your head were made of bronze.

18620.text: /So a long time ago I told you about these things./_I told you about them before they happened./I did this so you couldn’t say, ‘My idols did this./_My wooden and metal statues made these things happen.’

18621.text: ¶“You heard and saw all the things that happened./_So you should tell this news to others./Now I will tell you about new things./_These are hidden things that you don’t know yet.

18622.text: /These things are happening now, not long ago./_You have not heard about them before today./So you cannot say, ‘We already knew about that.’

18623.text: /But you have not heard me. You have not understood./_Even long ago you did not listen to me./I knew you would surely turn against me./_You have fought against me since you were born.

18624.text: /But for my own sake I will be patient./_People will praise me for not becoming angry/_and destroying you.

18625.text: /I have made you pure, but not by fire, as silver is made pure./_I have purified you by giving you troubles.

18626.text: /I do this for myself, for my own sake./_I will not let people speak evil against me./_I will not let some false god take my glory.

18627.text: §¶“People of Jacob, listen to me./_People of Israel, I have called you to be my people./I am God./_I am the beginning and the end.

18628.text: /I made the earth with my own hands./_With my right hand I spread out the skies./When I call them,/_they come together before me.

18629.text: ¶“All of you, come together and listen./_None of the false gods said these things would happen./I, the Lord, have chosen someone/_to attack the Babylonians./_He will carry out my wishes against Babylon.

18630.text: /I have spoken. I have called him./_I have brought him, and I will make him successful.

18631.text: /Come to me and listen to this./_From the beginning I have spoken openly./_From the time it began, I was there.”¶Now, the Lord God/_has sent me with his Spirit.

18632.text: ¶The Lord is your close relative who saves you, the Holy One of Israel./_The Lord says,/“I am the Lord your God./_I teach you to do what is good./_I lead you in the way you should go.

18633.text: /If you had obeyed me,/_you would have had peace like a full‐flowing river./_Good things would have flowed to you like the waves of the sea.

18634.text: /You would have had many children./_They would have been as many as the grains of sand./They would never have died out./_They would not have been destroyed.”

18635.text: ¶My people, leave Babylon!/_Run from the Babylonians!/Tell this news with shouts of joy to the people./_Spread it everywhere on earth./Say, “The Lord has saved/_his servants, the people of Jacob.”

18636.text: /They did not become thirsty when he led them through the deserts./_He made water flow from a rock for them./He split the rock,/_and water flowed out.

18637.text: ¶“There is no peace for evil people,” says the Lord.

18638.text: §¶All of you people in faraway places, listen to me./_Listen, all you nations far away./Before I was born, the Lord called me to serve him./_The Lord named me while I was still in my mother’s body.

18639.text: /The Lord made my tongue like a sharp sword./_He hid me in the shadow of his hand./The Lord made me like a sharp arrow./_He hid me in the holder for his arrows.

18640.text: /The Lord told me, “Israel, you are my servant./_I will show my glory through you.”

18641.text: /But I said, “I have worked hard for nothing./_I have used all my power, but I did nothing useful./But the Lord will decide what my work is worth./_God will decide my reward.”

18642.text: /The Lord made me in the body of my mother/_so I would be his servant./He made me to lead the people of Jacob back to him./_He made me so that Israel might be gathered to him./The Lord will honor me./_I will get my strength from my God.

18643.text: /The Lord told me,/“You are an important servant to me./_You will bring back the tribes of Jacob./_You will bring back the people of Israel who are left alive./But, more importantly, I will make you a light for all nations./_You will show people all over the world the way to be saved.”

18644.text: ¶The Lord is your close relative who saves you./_He is the Holy One of Israel./He speaks to the one who is hated by the people./_He speaks to the servant of rulers./The Lord says, “Kings will see you and stand to honor you./_Great leaders will bow down before you./This is because the Lord can be trusted./_He is the Holy One of Israel, who has chosen you.”

18645.text: §¶This is what the Lord says:¶▼“At the right time I will hear your prayers./_On the day of salvation I will help you./I will protect you./_And you will be the sign of my agreement with the people./You will bring back the people to the land./_You will give the land that is now ruined back to its owners.

18646.text: /You will tell the prisoners, ‘Come out of your prison.’/_You will tell those in darkness, ‘Come into the light.’/The people will eat beside the roads./_They will find food even on bare hills.

18647.text: /They will not be hungry or thirsty./_Neither the hot sun nor the desert wind will hurt them./The God who comforts them will lead them./_He will lead them by springs of water.

18648.text: /I will make my mountains into roads for my people./_And the roads will be raised up.

18649.text: /Look, people are coming to me from far away./_They are coming from the north and from the west./_They are coming from Aswan in southern Egypt.”

18650.text: ¶Heavens and earth, be happy./_Mountains, shout with joy./Be happy because the Lord comforts his people./_He will comfort those who suffer.

18651.text: §¶But Jerusalem said, “The Lord has left me./_The Lord has forgotten me.”

18652.text: ¶The Lord answers, “Can a woman forget the baby she nurses?/_Can she feel no kindness for the child she gave birth to?/Even if she could forget her children,/_I will not forget you.

18653.text: /See, I have written your name on my hand./_Jerusalem, I always think about your walls.

18654.text: /Your children will soon return to you./_And the people who defeated you and destroyed you will leave.

18655.text: /Look up and look around you./_All your children are gathering to return to you.”/The Lord says, “As surely as I live,/_your children will be like jewels./_You will be as proud of them as a bride is of her jewels.

18656.text: ¶“You were destroyed and defeated./_Your land was made useless./But now you will have more people than the land can hold./_And those people who destroyed you will be far away.

18657.text: /Children were born to you while you were sad./_But they will say to you,/‘This place is too small for us./_Give us a bigger place to live.’

18658.text: /Then you will say to yourself,/_‘Who gave me all these children?/I was sad and lonely./_I was defeated and away from my people./_So who reared these children?/I was left all alone./_Where did all these children come from?’”

18659.text: ¶This is what the Lord God says:/“See, I will lift my hand to signal the nations./_I will raise my banner for all people to see./Then they will bring your sons back to you in their arms./_They will carry your daughters on their shoulders.

18660.text: /Kings will teach your children./_Daughters of kings will take care of those children./They will bow down before you./_They will kiss the dirt at your feet./Then you will know I am the Lord./_Anyone who trusts in me will not be disappointed.”

18661.text: ¶Can the wealth a soldier wins in war be taken away from him?/_Can a prisoner be freed from a powerful soldier?

18662.text: /But this is what the Lord says:/“The prisoners will be taken from the strong soldiers./_What the soldiers have taken will be saved./I will fight your enemies./_I will save your children.

18663.text: /I will force those who trouble you to eat their own flesh./_Their own blood will be the wine that makes them drunk./Then everyone will know/_I, the Lord, am the One who saves you./_I am the Powerful One of Jacob who saves you.”

18664.text: §¶This is what the Lord says:¶▼“People of Israel, you say I divorced your mother./_Then where is the paper that proves it?/Or do you think I sold you to pay a debt?/No! It was because of the evil things you did that I sold you./_It was because of the times she turned against me that your mother was sent away.

18665.text: /I came home and found no one there./_I called, but no one answered./Do you think I am not able to save you?/_Do I not have the power to save you?/Look, I need only to shout, and the sea becomes dry./_I change rivers into a desert./Their fish rot because there is no water./_The fish die of thirst.

18666.text: /I can make the skies dark./_I can make them black like clothes of sadness.”

18667.text: §¶The Lord God gave me the ability to teach./_He has taught me what to say to make the weak strong./Every morning he wakes me./_He teaches me to listen like a student.

18668.text: /The Lord God helps me learn./_And I have not turned against him./_I have not stopped following him.

18669.text: /I offered my back to those who beat me./_I offered my cheeks to those who pulled my beard./I won’t hide my face from them/_when they make fun of me and spit at me.

18670.text: /The Lord God helps me./_So I will not be ashamed./I will be determined./_I know I will not be disgraced.

18671.text: /The Lord shows that I am innocent, and he is close to me./_So who can accuse me?/_If there is someone, let us go to court together./If someone wants to prove I have done wrong,/_he should come and tell me.

18672.text: /It is the Lord God who helps me./_So who can prove me guilty?/All those who try will become useless like old clothes./_Moths will eat them.

18673.text: ¶Who among you fears the Lord/_and obeys his servant?/That person may walk in the dark/_and have no light./Then let him trust in the Lord./_Let him depend on his God.

18674.text: /But instead, some of you want to light your own fires./_You want to make your own light./So, go, walk in the light of your fires./_Trust your own light to guide you./But this is what you will receive from me:/_You will lie down in a place of pain.

18675.text: §¶The Lord says, “Listen to me,/_those of you who try to live right and follow the Lord./Look at the rock from which you were cut./_Look at the stone quarry from which you were dug.

18676.text: /Look at Abraham, your ancestor./_Look at Sarah, who gave birth to your ancestors./Abraham had no children when I called him./_But I blessed him and gave him many descendants.

18677.text: /So the Lord will comfort Jerusalem./_He will show mercy to those who live in her ruins./He will change her deserts into a garden like Eden./_He will make her empty lands like the garden of the Lord./People there will be very happy./_They will give thanks and sing songs.

18678.text: ¶“My people, listen to me./_My nation, pay attention to me./I will give the people my teachings./_And my decisions will be like a light to all people.

18679.text: /I will soon show I do what is right./_I will soon save you./_I will use my power and judge all nations./All the faraway places are waiting for me./_They wait for my power to help them.

18680.text: /Look up to the heavens./_Look around you at the earth below./The skies will disappear like clouds of smoke./_The earth will become useless like old clothes./_Its people will die like flies./But my salvation will continue forever./_My goodness will never end.

18681.text: ¶“You people who know what is right should listen to me./_You people who follow my teachings should hear what I say./Don’t be afraid of the evil things people say./_Don’t be upset by their insults.

18682.text: /Moths will eat those people as if they were clothes./_Worms will eat them as if they were wool./But my goodness will continue forever./_My salvation will continue from now on.”

18683.text: ¶Wake up, wake up, and use your strength,/_powerful Lord./Wake up as you did in the old times./_Wake up as you did a long time ago./With your own power, you cut Rahab into pieces./_You killed that sea monster.

18684.text: /You caused the sea to become dry./_You dried the waters of the deep ocean./You made the deepest parts of the sea into a road./_Your people crossed over on that road and were saved.

18685.text: /The people the Lord has freed will return./_They will enter Jerusalem with joy./_Their happiness will last forever./They will have joy and gladness./_All sadness and sorrow will be gone far away.

18686.text: ¶The Lord says, “I am the one who comforts you./_So why should you be afraid of people, who die?/_Why should you fear people who die like the grass?

18687.text: /Have you forgotten that the Lord made you?/_He stretched out the skies./_He made the earth./Why are you always afraid/_of those angry people who trouble you?/_They want to destroy./But where are those angry people now?

18688.text: /_People in prison will soon be set free./They will not die in prison./_They will have enough food.

18689.text: /This is because I am the Lord your God./_I stir the sea and make the waves roar./_My name is the Lord of heaven’s armies.

18690.text: /I will give you the words I want you to say./_I will cover you with my hands and protect you./I made the heavens and the earth./_And I say to Jerusalem, ‘You are my people.’”

18691.text: §¶The Lord was very angry with you./_Your punishment was like wine in a cup./The Lord made you drink that wine/_until you stumbled.

18692.text: /Jerusalem had many people./_But there was not a person to lead her./Of all the people who grew up there,/_no one was there to guide her.

18693.text: /Troubles came to you in groups of two./_No one will feel sorry for you./There was ruin and disaster, great hunger and fighting./_No one can comfort you.

18694.text: /Your people have become weak./_They fall down and lie on every street corner./_They are like animals caught in a net./They have felt the full anger of the Lord./_They have heard God’s angry shout.

18695.text: ¶So listen to me, poor Jerusalem,/_you who are drunk but not from wine.

18696.text: /Your God will fight for his people./_This is what the Lord your God says:/“The punishment I gave you is like a cup of wine./_You drank it and could not walk straight./I am taking that cup of my anger away from you./_You will never be punished by my anger again.

18697.text: /I will now give that cup of punishment to those who gave you pain./They told you,/_‘Bow down so we can walk over you.’/They made your back like dirt for them to walk on./_You were like a street for them to travel on.”

18698.text: §¶Wake up, wake up, Jerusalem!/_Become strong!/Be beautiful again,/_holy city of Jerusalem./The people who do not worship God and who are not pure/_will not enter you again.

18699.text: /Jerusalem, you once were a prisoner./_Now shake off the dust and stand up./Jerusalem, you once were a prisoner./_But now free yourself from the chains around your neck.

18700.text: /This is what the Lord says:/“You were not sold for a price./_So you will be saved without cost.”

18701.text: /This is what the Lord God says:/“First my people went down to Egypt to live./_Later Assyria made them slaves.

18702.text: ¶“Now see what has happened,” says the Lord./“Another nation has taken away my people for nothing./_This nation who rules them makes fun of me,” says the Lord./_“All day long they speak against me.

18703.text: /But this has happened so my people will know who I am./_They will know I am God./_And they will know that I am the one speaking to them.”

18704.text: ¶How beautiful is the person/_who comes over the mountains to bring good news./How beautiful is the one who announces peace./_He brings good news/_and announces salvation./How beautiful are the feet of the one who says to Jerusalem,/_“Your God is king.”

18705.text: /Listen! Your guards are shouting./_They are all shouting for joy!/They all will see with their own eyes/_when the Lord returns to Jerusalem.

18706.text: /Jerusalem, your buildings are destroyed now./_But shout and rejoice together./You can rejoice because the Lord has comforted his people./_He has saved Jerusalem.

18707.text: /The Lord will show his holy power/_to all the nations./Then everyone on earth/_will see the salvation of our God.

18708.text: ¶You people, leave, leave; get out of Babylon!/_Touch nothing that is unclean./You men who carry the things used in worship,/_leave there and make yourselves pure.

18709.text: /You will not be forced to leave Babylon quickly./_You will not be forced to run away./The Lord will go before you./_And the God of Israel will guard you from behind.

18710.text: §¶The Lord says, “See, my servant will act wisely./_People will greatly honor and respect him.

18711.text: /Many people were shocked when they saw him./_His appearance was so damaged he did not look like a man./_His form was changed so much they could barely tell he was human.

18712.text: /But now he will sprinkle many people./_Kings will be amazed and shut their mouths./They will see the things they had not been told about my servant./_They will understand the things they had not heard.”

18713.text: ¶Who would have believed what we heard?/_Who saw the Lord’s power in this?

18714.text: /He grew up like a small plant before the Lord./_He was like a root growing in a dry land./He had no special beauty or form to make us notice him./_There was nothing in his appearance to make us desire him.

18715.text: /He was hated and rejected by people./_He had much pain and suffering./People would not even look at him./_He was hated, and we didn’t even notice him.

18716.text: ¶But he took our suffering on him/_and felt our pain for us./We saw his suffering./_We thought God was punishing him.

18717.text: /But he was wounded for the wrong things we did./_He was crushed for the evil things we did./The punishment, which made us well, was given to him./_And we are healed because of his wounds.

18718.text: /We all have wandered away like sheep./_Each of us has gone his own way./But the Lord has put on him the punishment/_for all the evil we have done.

18719.text: ¶He was beaten down and punished./_But he didn’t say a word./He was like a lamb being led to be killed./_He was quiet, as a sheep is quiet while its wool is being cut./_He never opened his mouth.

18720.text: /Men took him away roughly and unfairly./_He died without children to continue his family./He was put to death./_He was punished for the sins of my people.

18721.text: /He was buried with wicked men./_He died with the rich./He had done nothing wrong./_He had never lied.

18722.text: ¶But it was the Lord who decided/_to crush him and make him suffer./_So the Lord made his life a penalty offering./But he will see his descendants and live a long life./_He will complete the things the Lord wants him to do.

18723.text: /He will suffer many things in his soul./_But then he will see life and be satisfied./My good servant will make many people right with God./_He carried away their sins.

18724.text: /For this reason I will make him a great man among people./_He will share in all things with those who are strong./He willingly gave his life./_He was treated like a criminal./But he carried away the sins of many people./_And he asked forgiveness for those who sinned.

18725.text: §¶The Lord says, “Sing, Jerusalem./_You are like a woman who never gave birth to children./Start singing and shout for joy./_You never felt the pain of giving birth./But you will have more children/_than the woman who has a husband.

18726.text: /Make your tent bigger./_Stretch it out and make it wider./_Do not hold back./Make the ropes longer./_Make its stakes stronger.

18727.text: /Do this because you will begin growing very much./_Your children will take over other nations./_And they will again live in cities that once were destroyed.

18728.text: ¶“Don’t be afraid because you will not be ashamed./_Don’t be embarrassed because you will not be disgraced./You will forget the shame you felt earlier./_You will not remember the shame you felt when you lost your husband.

18729.text: /This is because the God who made you is like your husband./_His name is the Lord of heaven’s armies./The Holy One of Israel is the one who saves you./_He is called the God of all the earth.

18730.text: /You were like a woman whose husband left her./_And you were very sad./You were like a wife who married young/_and then her husband left her./But the Lord called you to be his,”/_says your God.

18731.text: /God says, “I left you, but only for a short time./_But with great kindness I will bring you back again.

18732.text: /I became very angry/_and hid from you for a short time./But I will show you mercy with kindness forever,”/_says the Lord your close relative who saves you.

18733.text: ¶The Lord says, “This is like the time of Noah./I promised then/_that I would never flood the world again./In the same way, I promise/_I will not be angry with you or punish you again.

18734.text: /The mountains may disappear,/_and the hills may come to an end./But my love will never disappear./_My promise of peace will not come to an end,”/_says the Lord who shows mercy to you.

18735.text: ¶“You poor city. Storms have hurt you,/_and you have not been comforted./But I will rebuild you using turquoise stones./_I will build your foundations with sapphires.

18736.text: /I will use rubies to build your walls./_I will use shining jewels for the gates./_I will build all your outer walls from precious jewels.

18737.text: /All your children will be taught by the Lord./_And they will have much peace.

18738.text: /I will build you using fairness./You will be safe from those who would hurt you./_So you will have nothing to fear./_Nothing will come to make you afraid.

18739.text: /I will not send anyone to attack you./_And you will defeat those who do attack you.

18740.text: ¶“See, I made the blacksmith./_He fans the fire to make it hotter./_And he makes the kind of tool he wants./In the same way I have made the destroyer to destroy.

18741.text: /_So no weapon that is used against you will defeat you./_You will show that those who speak against you are wrong./These are the good things my servants receive./_Their victory comes from me,” says the Lord.

18742.text: §¶The Lord says, “All you who are thirsty,/_come and drink./Those of you who do not have money,/_come, buy and eat!/Come buy wine and milk./_You don’t need money; it will cost you nothing.

18743.text: /Why spend your money on something that is not real food?/_Why work for something that doesn’t really satisfy you?/Listen closely to me, and you will eat what is good./_You will enjoy the food that satisfies your soul.

18744.text: /Come to me and listen./_Listen to me so you may live./I will make an agreement with you that will last forever./_I will give you the blessings I promised to David.

18745.text: /I made David a witness of my power for all nations./_I made him a ruler and commander of many nations.

18746.text: /You will call for nations that you don’t yet know./_And these nations will run to you./This will happen because of the Lord your God./_The Holy One of Israel honors you.”

18747.text: ¶So you should look for the Lord before it is too late./_You should call to him while he is near.

18748.text: /Evil people should stop being evil./_They should stop thinking bad thoughts./They should return to the Lord, and he will have mercy on them./_They should come to our God, because he will freely forgive them.

18749.text: ¶The Lord says, “Your thoughts are not like my thoughts./_Your ways are not like my ways.

18750.text: /Just as the heavens are higher than the earth,/_so are my ways higher than your ways./_And my thoughts are higher than your thoughts.

18751.text: /Rain and snow fall from the sky./_They don’t return without watering the ground./They cause the plants to sprout and grow./_And the plants make seeds for the farmer./_And from these seeds people have bread to eat.

18752.text: /The words I say do the same thing./_They will not return to me empty./They make the things happen that I want to happen./_They succeed in doing what I send them to do.

18753.text: ¶“So you will go out with joy./_You will be led out in peace./The mountains and hills will burst into song before you./_All the trees in the fields will clap their hands.

18754.text: /Large cypress trees will grow where thornbushes were./_Myrtle trees will grow where weeds were./These things will be a reminder of the Lord’s promise./_And this reminder will never be destroyed.”

18755.text: §¶This is what the Lord says:¶▼“Give justice to all people./_Do what is right./Do this because my salvation will come to you soon./_Soon everyone will know that I do what is right.

18756.text: /The person who obeys the law about the Sabbath/_will be blessed./And the person who does no evil/_will be blessed.”

18757.text: ¶Foreigners have joined the Lord. They should not say,/_“The Lord will not accept me with his people.”/The eunuch should not say,/_“Because I cannot have children the Lord will not accept me.”

18758.text: /This is what the Lord says:/“The eunuchs should obey the law about the Sabbath./_They should do what I want./_They should keep my agreement.

18759.text: /If they do, I will make their names remembered/_within my Temple and its walls./_It will be better for them than children./I will give them a name that will last forever./_It will never be forgotten.

18760.text: /Foreigners will join the Lord to serve him./_They will worship and love him./_They will worship him./They will obey the law about the Sabbath./_They will keep the agreement with the Lord.

18761.text: /I will bring these people to my holy mountain./_I will give them joy in my house of prayer./The offerings and sacrifices/_they place on my altar will please me./This is because my Temple will be called/_a house for prayer for people from all nations.”

18762.text: /The Lord gathers the Israelites who were forced to leave their country./_This is what the Lord God says,/“I will bring other people to those who are already gathered.”

18763.text: §¶All you animals of the field, come to eat./_All you animals of the forest, come to eat.

18764.text: /The leaders who are to guard the people are blind./_They don’t know what they are doing./All of them are like quiet dogs./_They don’t know how to bark./They lie down and dream./_They love to sleep.

18765.text: /They are like hungry dogs./_They are never satisfied./They are like shepherds/_who don’t know what they are doing./They each have gone their own way./_All they want to do is satisfy themselves.

18766.text: /They say, “Come, let’s drink some wine./_Let’s drink all the beer we want./And tomorrow we will do this again./_Or, maybe we will have even a better time.”

18767.text: §¶Those right with God may die,/_but no one pays attention./Good people are taken away,/_but no one understands./The people who do right are being taken away because of evil.

18768.text: /_But they are given peace./The people who live the way God wants them to/_find rest in death.

18769.text: ¶“Come here, you magicians!/_Come here, you sons of prostitutes and those who take part in adultery!

18770.text: /Whom are you making fun of?/_Whom are you insulting?/_At whom do you stick out your tongue?/You turn against God,/_and you are liars.

18771.text: /You sin sexually under every green tree/_to worship your false gods./You kill children in the ravines/_and sacrifice them in the rocky places.

18772.text: /You take the smooth rocks from the ravines./_They are your portion./You pour drink offerings on them to worship them./_You give grain offerings to them./_Do you think this makes me want to forgive you?

18773.text: /You make your bed on every hill and mountain./_And there you offer sacrifices.

18774.text: /You have hidden your idols/_behind your doors and doorposts./You have left me, and you have uncovered yourself./_You have pulled back the covers and climbed into bed./You have made an agreement with/_the ones whose beds you love./_And you have looked at their nakedness.

18775.text: /You use your oils and perfumes/_to look nice for Molech./You have sent your messengers to faraway lands./_You even tried to send them to where the dead are.

18776.text: /You have worked hard to do these things./_But you never gave up./You found new strength./_So you did not quit.

18777.text: ¶“Whom were you so afraid of/_that you lied to me?/You have not remembered me/_or even thought about me./I have been quiet for a long time./_Is that why you are not afraid of me?

18778.text: /I will tell about your ‘goodness’ and what you do./_And those things will do you no good.

18779.text: /When you cry out for help,/_let the false gods you have gathered help you./The wind will blow them all away./_Just a puff of wind will take them away./But the person who depends on me will receive the land./_He will have my holy mountain.”

18780.text: §¶The Lord says, “Build a road! Build a road! Prepare the way!/_Make the way clear for my people.”

18781.text: /God lives forever and is holy./_He is high and lifted up, and he says,/“I live in a high and holy place./_But I also live with people who are sad and humble./I give new life to those who are humble./_I give new life to those whose hearts are broken.

18782.text: /I will not accuse forever./_I will not always be angry./If I continued to be angry, man’s life would grow weak./_Man, whom I created, would die.

18783.text: /I was angry because they were dishonest in order to make money./_I punished them and turned away from them in anger./_But they continued to do evil.

18784.text: /I have seen what they have done, but I will heal them./_I will guide them and comfort them./_And those who were sad will praise me.

18785.text: /I will give peace, real peace, to those far and near./_And I will heal them,” says the Lord.

18786.text: /But evil people are like the angry sea./_It cannot rest./_Its waves toss up waste and mud.

18787.text: /“There is no peace for evil people,” says my God.

18788.text: §¶The Lord says, “Shout out loud. Don’t hold back./_Shout out loud like a trumpet./Tell the people about the things they have done against God./_Tell the family of Jacob about their sins.

18789.text: /Then they will come every day looking for me./_And they will want to learn my ways./They will become a nation that does what is right./_They will obey the commands of their God./They will ask me to judge them fairly./_They will want God to be near them.

18790.text: /They say, ‘To honor you we had special days when we gave up eating./_But you didn’t see./We humbled ourselves to honor you./_But you didn’t notice.’”¶But the Lord says, “You do what pleases yourselves on these special days./_And you are unfair to your workers.

18791.text: /On these special days when you do not eat, you argue and fight./_You hit each other with your fists./You cannot do these things as you do now/_and believe I will listen to your prayers.

18792.text: /This kind of special day is not what I want./_This is not the way I want people to be sorry for what they have done./I don’t want people just to bow their heads like a plant./_I don’t want them to wear rough cloth and lie in ashes to show their sadness./This is what you do on your special days when you do not eat./_But do you think this is what the Lord wants?

18793.text: ¶“I will tell you the kind of special day I want./I want you to free the people you have put in prison unfairly./_Undo their chains./Free those to whom you are unfair./_Free them from their hard labor.

18794.text: /I want you to share your food with hungry people./_I want you to bring poor, homeless people into your own homes./When you see someone who has no clothes, give him yours./_Don’t refuse to help your own relatives.

18795.text: /If you do these things, your light will shine like the dawn./_Then your wounds will quickly heal./Your God will walk before you,/_and the glory of the Lord will protect you from behind.

18796.text: /Then you will call to the Lord, and the Lord will answer you./_You will cry out to the Lord, and he will say, ‘Here I am.’¶“You should stop making trouble for others./_You should stop using cruel words and pointing your finger at others.

18797.text: /You should feed those who are hungry./_You should take care of the needs of those who are troubled./Then your light will shine in the darkness./_And you will be bright like sunshine at noon.

18798.text: /The Lord will always lead you./_He will satisfy your needs in dry lands./_He will give strength to your bones./You will be like a garden that has much water./_You will be like a spring that never runs dry.

18799.text: /Your people will rebuild the old cities that are now in ruins./_You will rebuild the foundations of these ancient cities./You will be known for repairing the broken places./_You will be known for rebuilding the roads and houses.

18800.text: ¶“You must obey God’s law about the Sabbath./_You must not do what pleases yourselves on that holy day./You should call the Sabbath a joyful day./_You should honor the Lord’s holy day./You should honor it by not doing whatever you please on that day./_You should not say whatever you please on that day.

18801.text: /Then you will find joy in the Lord./_And I, the Lord, will carry you to the high places above the earth./_I will let you eat the crops of the land your ancestor Jacob had.”¶►The Lord has said these things.

18802.text: §¶Surely the Lord’s power is enough to save you./_He can hear you when you ask him for help.

18803.text: /It is your evil that has separated/_you from your God./Your sins cause him to turn away from you./_And then he does not hear you.

18804.text: /With your hands you have killed others./_Your fingers are covered with blood from killing people./With your lips you have lied./_With your tongue you say evil things.

18805.text: /People take each other to court unfairly./_No one tells the truth in arguing his case./They accuse each other falsely and tell lies./_They cause trouble and create more evil.

18806.text: /They hatch evil like eggs from poisonous snakes./_If you eat one of those eggs, you will die./_And if you break one open, a poisonous snake comes out./People tell lies as they would spin a spider’s web.

18807.text: /_The webs they make cannot be used for clothes./_You can’t cover yourself with those webs./The things they do are evil./_They use their hands to hurt others.

18808.text: /They eagerly run to do evil./_They are always ready to kill innocent people./They think evil thoughts./_Everywhere they go they cause ruin and destruction.

18809.text: /They don’t know how to live in peace./_There is no fairness in their lives./They are dishonest./_Anyone who lives as they live will never have peace.

18810.text: §¶Fairness has gone far away./_Goodness is nowhere to be found./We wait for the light, but there is only darkness now./_We hope for a bright light, but all we have is darkness.

18811.text: /We are like blind people feeling our way along a wall./_We have to feel our way as if we had no eyes./In the brightness of day we trip as if it were night./_We are like dead men among the strong.

18812.text: /All of us growl like the bears./_We call out sadly like the doves./We look for justice, but there isn’t any./_We want to be saved, but salvation is far away.

18813.text: ¶We have done many wrong things against our God./_Our sins show we are wrong./We know we have turned against God./_We know the evil things we have done.

18814.text: /We have sinned and turned against the Lord./_We have turned away from our God./We have planned to hurt others and to disobey God./_We have planned and spoken lies.

18815.text: /We have driven away justice./_We have kept away from what is right./Truth is not spoken in the streets./_What is honest is not allowed to enter the city.

18816.text: /Truth cannot be found anywhere./_And people who refuse to do evil are attacked.¶The Lord looked and could not find any justice./_And he was displeased.

18817.text: /He could not find anyone to help the people./_He was surprised that there was no one to help./So the Lord used his own power to save the people./_His own goodness gave him strength.

18818.text: /The Lord covered himself with goodness like armor./_He put on the helmet of salvation./He put on the clothes of punishment./_And he put on the coat of his strong love.

18819.text: /The Lord will pay back his enemies for what they have done./_He will show his anger to those who were against him./He will punish the people in faraway places./_He will give them the punishment they should have.

18820.text: /Then people from the west will fear the Lord./_People in the east will fear his glory./The Lord will come quickly like a fast‐flowing river,/_driven by the breath of the Lord.

18821.text: ¶“Then a close relative who will save you will come to Jerusalem./_He will come to the people of Jacob who sinned but turned back to God,”/_says the Lord.

18822.text: ¶The Lord says, “I will make an agreement with these people. I promise that my Spirit and my words that I give you will never leave you. They will be with your children and your grandchildren. They will be with you now and forever.”

18823.text: §¶“Jerusalem, get up and shine. Your light has come./_The glory of the Lord shines on you.

18824.text: /Darkness now covers the earth./_Deep darkness covers her people./But the Lord shines on you,/_and people see his glory around you.

18825.text: /Nations will come to your light./_Kings will come to the brightness of your sunrise.

18826.text: ¶“Look around you./_People are gathering and coming to you./They are your sons coming from far away./_And your daughters are coming with them.

18827.text: /When you see them, you will shine with happiness./_You will be excited and full of joy./The wealth of the nations across the seas will be given to you./_The riches of the nations will come to you.

18828.text: /Herds of camels will cover your land./_Young camels will come from Midian and Ephah./People will come from Sheba/_bringing gold and incense./_And they will sing praises to the Lord.

18829.text: /All the sheep from Kedar will be given to you./_The male sheep from Nebaioth will be brought to you./They will be pleasing sacrifices on my altar./_And I will make my beautiful Temple more beautiful.

18830.text: ¶“The people are returning to you like clouds./_They are like doves flying to their nests.

18831.text: /People in faraway lands are waiting for me./_The great trading ships will come first./They are bringing your children from faraway lands./_And with them they bring silver and gold./This will happen to honor the Lord your God./_He is the Holy One of Israel./_And he does wonderful things for you.

18832.text: ¶“Jerusalem, foreigners will rebuild your walls./_Their kings will serve you./When I was angry, I hurt you./_But now I want to be kind to you and comfort you.

18833.text: /Your gates will always be open./_They will not be closed day or night/so the nations can bring their wealth to you./_And their kings will be led to you.

18834.text: /If a nation or kingdom doesn’t serve you,/_it will be destroyed./_It will be completely ruined.

18835.text: ¶“The great trees of Lebanon will be given to you./_Its pine, fir and cypress trees will come to you./You will use these trees to make my Temple beautiful./_And I will give much honor to this place where I rest my feet.

18836.text: /The people who have hurt you will bow down to you./_Those who hated you will bow down at your feet./They will call you The City of the Lord./_They will call you Jerusalem, city of the Holy One of Israel.

18837.text: ¶“You have been hated and left empty./_No one has even passed through./But I will make you great from now on./_You will be a place of happiness forever and ever.

18838.text: /Nations will give you what you need./_It will be like a child drinking milk from its mother./Then you will know that it is I, the Lord, who saves you./_You will know that the Powerful One of Jacob protects you.

18839.text: /I will bring you gold in place of bronze./_I will bring you silver in place of iron./I will bring you bronze in place of wood./_I will bring you iron in place of rocks./I will change your punishment into peace./_And you will be ruled by what is right.

18840.text: /There will be no more violence in your country./_It will not be ruined or destroyed./You will name your walls Salvation./_And you will name your gates Praise.

18841.text: /The sun will no longer be your light during the day./_The light from the moon will no longer be your light./This is because the Lord will be your light forever./_Your God will be your glory.

18842.text: /Your sun will never set again./_Your moon will never be dark again./This is because the Lord will be your light forever./_And your time of sadness will end.

18843.text: /All of your people will do what is right./_They will receive the earth forever./They are the plant I have planted./_I made them with my own hands to show my greatness.

18844.text: /The smallest family will grow to a thousand./_The least important of you will become a powerful nation./I am the Lord,/_and when it is time, I will make these things happen quickly.”

18845.text: §¶The Lord God has put his Spirit in me./_This is because he has appointed me to tell the good news to the poor./_He has sent me to comfort those whose hearts are broken./He has sent me to tell the captives they are free./_He has sent me to tell the prisoners that they are released.

18846.text: /He has sent me to announce the time when the Lord will show his kindness/_and the time when our God will punish evil people./He has sent me to comfort all those who are sad.

18847.text: /He has sent me to the sorrowing people of Jerusalem./_I will give them a crown to replace their ashes./I will give them the oil of gladness to replace their sorrow./_I will give them clothes of praise to replace their spirit of sadness./Then they will be called Trees of Goodness./_They will be like trees planted by the Lord and will show his greatness.

18848.text: ¶They will rebuild the old ruins./_They will build up the places destroyed long ago./They will repair the ruined cities/_that were destroyed for so long.

18849.text: ¶My people, foreigners will come to tend your sheep./_People from other countries will tend your vineyards.

18850.text: /You will be called priests of the Lord./_You will be named the servants of our God./You will have riches from all the nations on earth./_And you will take pride in them.

18851.text: /Instead of being ashamed, you will receive twice as much wealth./_Instead of being disgraced, you will be happy because of what you receive./You will receive a double share of the land./_So your happiness will continue forever.

18852.text: /The Lord says, “I love justice./_I hate stealing and everything that is wrong./I will be fair and give my people what they should have./_I will make an agreement with them that will continue forever.

18853.text: /Everyone in all nations will know the children of my people./_And their children will be known among the nations./Anyone who sees them will know/_that the Lord blesses them.”

18854.text: ¶The Lord makes me very happy./_All that I am rejoices in my God./The Lord has covered me with clothes of salvation./_He has covered me with a coat of goodness./I am like a bridegroom dressed for his wedding./_I am like a bride dressed in jewels.

18855.text: /The earth causes plants to grow./_And a garden causes the seeds planted there to grow./In the same way the Lord God will make grow what is right./_He will make praise come from all the nations.

18856.text: §¶Because I love Jerusalem, I will continue to speak for her./_For Jerusalem’s sake I will not stop speaking./I will speak until her goodness shines like a bright light./_I will speak until her salvation burns bright like a flame.

18857.text: /Jerusalem, the nations will see your goodness./_All kings will see your honor./Then you will have a new name./_The Lord himself will give you that new name.

18858.text: /You will be like a beautiful crown in the Lord’s hand./_You will be like a king’s crown in your God’s hand.

18859.text: /You will never again be called the People that God Left./_Your land will never again be called the Land that God Destroyed./You will be called the People God Loves./_Your land will be called the Bride of God./This is because the Lord loves you./_And your land will belong to him as a bride belongs to her husband.

18860.text: /As a young man marries a woman,/_so your children will marry your land./As a man is very happy about his new wife,/_so your God will be happy with you.

18861.text: ¶Jerusalem, I have put guards on the walls to watch./_They must not be silent day or night./You people who remind the Lord/_should never be quiet.

18862.text: /You should not stop praying to the Lord until he builds up Jerusalem./_Don’t stop until he makes Jerusalem a city all people will praise.

18863.text: ¶The Lord has made a promise./_And by his power he will keep his promise./He said, “I will never again give your grain/_as food to your enemies./I will not let your enemies drink the wine/_that you have worked to make.

18864.text: /The person who gathers food will eat it./_And he will praise the Lord./The person who gathers the grapes will drink the wine/_in the courts of my Temple.”

18865.text: ¶Go through, go through the gates!/_Make the way ready for the people./Build up, build up the road!/_Move all the stones off the road./Raise the banner as a sign for the people.

18866.text: ¶The Lord is speaking/_to all the faraway lands:/“Tell the people of Jerusalem,/_‘Look, your Savior is coming./He is bringing your reward to you./_He is bringing his payment with him.’”

18867.text: /His people will be called the Holy People./_They will be called the Saved People of the Lord./And Jerusalem will be called the City God Wants./_It will be named the City God Has Not Rejected.

18868.text: §¶Who is this coming from Edom?/_He comes from the city of Bozrah dressed in red./Who is this dressed in fine clothes?/_He marches forward with his great power.¶He says, “I, the Lord, speak what is right./_I have the power to save you.”

18869.text: ¶Why are your clothes bright red/_as if you had walked on the grapes to make wine?

18870.text: ¶The Lord answers, “I have walked in the winepress alone./_No one among the nations helped me./I was angry and walked on the nations./_I crushed them because of my anger./Blood splashed on my clothes./_I stained all my clothing.

18871.text: /I chose a time to punish people./_And the time has come for me to save my people.

18872.text: /I looked around, but I saw no one to help me./_I was surprised that no one supported me./So I used my own power to save my people./_My own anger supported me.

18873.text: /While I was angry, I walked on the nations./_In my anger I punished them/_and poured their blood on the ground.”

18874.text: §¶I will tell about the Lord’s kindness./_And I will praise him for what he has done./He has given many good things to us./_He has been very good to the people of Israel./The Lord has shown mercy to us./_And he has been kind to us.

18875.text: /The Lord said, “These are my people./_My children will not lie to me.”/_So the Lord saved them.

18876.text: /When they suffered, he suffered also./_He sent his own angel to save them./Because of his love and kindness, the Lord saved them./_Since long ago he has picked them up and carried them.

18877.text: /But they turned against the Lord./_They made his Holy Spirit very sad./So the Lord became their enemy./_And he fought against them.

18878.text: ¶But then his people remembered what happened long ago./_They remembered Moses./Where is the Lord who brought the people through the sea?/_Where is the one who brought them with the leaders of his people?/Where is the one/_who put his Holy Spirit among them?

18879.text: /The Lord led Moses by the right hand./_The Lord led him by his wonderful power./The Lord divided the water before them so the people could walk through the sea./_And by this the Lord made his name famous forever.

18880.text: /The Lord led the people through the deep waters./Like a horse walking through a desert,/_the people did not stumble.

18881.text: /Like cattle that go down to the valley,/_the Spirit of the Lord led the people to a place of rest./Lord, that is the way you led your people./_And by this you made your name wonderful.

18882.text: §¶Lord, look down from the heavens and see./_Look at us from your wonderful holy home in heaven./Where is your strong love and power?/_Why are you keeping your love and mercy from us?

18883.text: /You are our father./_Abraham doesn’t know we are his children./_Israel doesn’t know who we are./Lord, you are our father./_You are called “the one who has always saved us.”

18884.text: /Lord, why are you making us wander from your ways?/_Why do you make us stubborn so that we don’t honor you?/For our sake come back to us./_We are your servants, and we belong to you.

18885.text: /Your people had your Temple for a while./_But now our enemies have walked on your holy place and crushed it.

18886.text: /You have never ruled over some people./_They have never worn your name./And we have become like those people.

18887.text: ¶Tear open the skies and come down to earth./_The mountains would tremble before you.

18888.text: /Be like a fire that burns twigs./_Be like a fire that makes water boil./Do this so that your enemies will know who you are./_Then all nations will shake with fear when they see you.

18889.text: /You have done amazing things that we did not expect./_You came down, and the mountains trembled before you.

18890.text: /From long ago no one has ever heard of a God like you./_No one has ever seen a God besides you./_You help the people who trust you.

18891.text: /You help those who enjoy doing good./_You help those who remember how you want them to live./But you were angry because we sinned./_For a long time we disobeyed./_How will we be saved?

18892.text: /All of us are dirty with sin./_All the right things we have done are like filthy pieces of cloth./All of us are like dead leaves./_Like the wind our sins have carried us away.

18893.text: /No one worships you./_No one even asks you to help us./So you have turned away from us./_And we are destroyed because of our sins.

18894.text: ¶But Lord, you are our father./_We are like clay, and you are the potter./_Your hands made us all.

18895.text: /Lord, don’t continue to be angry with us./_Don’t remember our sins forever./Please, look at us/_because we are your people.

18896.text: /Your holy cities are empty like the desert./_Jerusalem is like a desert;/_Jerusalem is destroyed.

18897.text: /Our ancestors worshiped you/_in our holy and wonderful Temple./But now it has been burned with fire./_All our precious things have been destroyed.

18898.text: /When you see these things, will you hold yourself back from helping us, Lord?/_Will you be silent and punish us beyond what we can stand?

18899.text: §¶The Lord says, “I made myself known to people who were not looking for me./_I was found by those who were not asking me for help./I spoke to a nation that was not praying to me./_I said, ‘Here I am. Here I am.’

18900.text: /All day long I stood ready to accept/_people who turned against me./But the way they continue to live is not good./_They do anything they want to do.

18901.text: /Right in front of me they continue/_to do things that make me angry./_They offer sacrifices to their false gods in their gardens./_They burn incense on altars of brick.

18902.text: /They sit among the graves./_They spend their nights waiting to get messages from the dead./They eat the meat of pigs./_Their pots are full of soup made from meat that is wrong to eat.

18903.text: /But they tell others, ‘Stay away. Don’t come near me./_I am too holy for you.’/These people are like smoke in my nose./_Like a fire that burns all the time, they continue to make me angry.

18904.text: ¶“Look, it is written here before me./_I will not be quiet. Instead, I will repay you in full./_I will punish you for what you have done.

18905.text: /I will punish you for your sins and your ancestors’ sins,”/_says the Lord./“They burned incense to false gods on the mountains./_They shamed me on those hills./So I will punish them as they should be punished/_for what they did.”

18906.text: ¶This is what the Lord says:/“When there is juice left in the grapes,/_people do not destroy them./_They know there is good left in them./I will do the same thing to my servants./_I will not completely destroy them.

18907.text: /I will leave some of the children of Jacob./_Some of the people of Judah will receive my mountain./I will choose the people who will live there./_My servants will live there.

18908.text: /Then the Plain of Sharon will be a field for sheep./_The Valley of Achor will be a place for cattle to rest./_They will be for the people who want to follow me.

18909.text: ¶“But you who left the Lord will be punished./_You forgot about my holy mountain./You worship the false god Luck./_You hold religious feasts for the false god Fate.

18910.text: /But I decide your fate, and I will punish you with my sword./_You will all be killed./This is because I called you, but you refused to answer./_I spoke to you, but you wouldn’t listen./You did the things I said were evil./_You chose to do things that displease me.”

18911.text: ¶So the Lord God said these things:/“My servants will eat./_But you evil people will be hungry./My servants will drink./_But you evil people will be thirsty./My servants will be happy./_But you evil people will be shamed.

18912.text: /My servants will shout for joy/_because of the goodness of their hearts./But you evil people will cry,/_because you will be sad./_You will cry loudly because your spirits will be broken.

18913.text: /Your names will be like curses to my servants./_And the Lord God will put you to death./_But he will call his servants by another name.

18914.text: /People in the land who ask for blessings/_will ask for them from the faithful God./People in the land who make a promise/_will promise in the name of the faithful God./This is because the troubles of the past will be forgotten./_I will make those troubles go away.

18915.text: §¶“Look, I will make new heavens and a new earth./_And people will not remember the past./_They will not think about those things.

18916.text: /My people will be happy forever/_because of the things I will make./I will make a Jerusalem that is full of joy./_And I will make her people a delight.

18917.text: /Then I will rejoice over Jerusalem./_I will be delighted with my people./There will never again be/_crying and sadness in that city.

18918.text: /There will never be a baby from that city/_who lives only a few days./And there will never be an older person/_who doesn’t have a long life./A person who lives 100 years will be called young./_And the person who dies before he is 100 will be thought of as a sinner.

18919.text: /In that city the person who builds a house will live there./_The person who plants vineyards will get to eat grapes.

18920.text: /No more will one person build a house and someone else live there./_One person will not plant a garden and someone else eat its fruit./My people will live a long time/_as trees live long./My chosen people will live there/_and enjoy the things they make.

18921.text: /People will never again work for nothing./_They will never again give birth to children who die young./All my people will be blessed by the Lord./_My people and their children will be blessed.

18922.text: /I will provide for their needs before they ask./_I will help them while they are still asking for help.

18923.text: /Wolves and lambs will eat together in peace./_Lions will eat hay like oxen./A snake on the ground will not hurt anyone./They will not hurt or destroy each other/_on all my holy mountain,”/says the Lord.

18924.text: §¶This is what the Lord says:¶“The skies are my throne./_The earth is my footstool./So do you think you can build a house for me?/_There is no place where I need to rest.

18925.text: /My hand made all things./_All things are here because I made them,”/says the Lord.¶“These are the people I am pleased with./_They are those who are not proud or stubborn./_They fear me and obey me.

18926.text: /But those people who kill bulls as a sacrifice to me/_are like those who kill men./Those who kill sheep as a sacrifice to me/_are like those who break the necks of dogs./Those who give me grain offerings/_are like those who offer me the blood of pigs./Those who burn incense/_are like those who worship idols./These people choose their own ways—not mine./_They love the terrible things they do.

18927.text: /So I will punish them./_I will punish them using what they fear most./I called to them, but they did not listen./_I spoke to them, but they did not hear me./They did things I said were evil./_They chose to do things I did not like.”

18928.text: ¶You people who obey the words of the Lord,/_listen to what he says:/“Your brothers hated you./_They turned against you because you followed me./Your brothers said, ‘When the Lord is honored,/_we will come back and rejoice with you.’/_But they will be punished.

18929.text: /Listen to the loud noise coming from the city./_Hear the noise from the Temple./It is the Lord punishing his enemies./_He is giving them the punishment they should have.

18930.text: ¶“A woman does not give birth before she feels the pain./_She does not give birth to a son before she feels the pain of birth.

18931.text: /No one has ever heard of that happening./_No one has ever seen that happen./In the same way no one ever saw a country begin in one day./_No one has ever heard of a new nation beginning in one day./But Jerusalem will give birth to her children/_just as soon as she feels the birth pains.

18932.text: /In the same way I will not cause pain/_without allowing something new to be born,” says the Lord./“If I cause you the pain,/_I will not stop you from giving birth to your new nation,” says your God.

18933.text: /“Jerusalem, rejoice./_All you people who love Jerusalem, be happy./Those of you who felt sad for Jerusalem/_should now feel happy with her.

18934.text: /You will enjoy her good things and be satisfied/_as a child is nursed by its mother./You will receive her good things/_and enjoy her wealth.”

18935.text: ¶This is what the Lord says:¶▼“I will give her peace that will flow to her like a river./_The wealth of the nations will come flowing to her./Like babies you will be nursed and held in my arms./_You will be bounced on my knees.

18936.text: /I will comfort you/_as a mother comforts her child./_You will be comforted in Jerusalem.”

18937.text: ¶When you see these things, you will be happy./_You will grow like the grass./The Lord’s servants will see his power./_But the Lord’s enemies will see his anger.

18938.text: /Look, the Lord is coming with fire./_The Lord’s armies are coming with clouds of dust./He will punish those people with his anger./_He will punish them with flames of fire.

18939.text: /The Lord will judge the people with fire./_He will destroy many people with his sword./_He will kill many people.

18940.text: ¶“These people make themselves holy and pure to go to worship their false gods in their gardens. They follow each other into their special gardens. They eat the meat of pigs and rats and other hated things. But they will all be destroyed together,” says the Lord.

18941.text: ¶“I know they have evil thoughts and do evil things. So I am coming to punish them. I will gather all nations and all people. All people will come together and see my glory.

18942.text: ¶“I will put a mark on some of the people. And I will send some of these saved people to the nations. I will send them to Tarshish, Libya, Lud (the land of archers), Tubal, Greece and all the faraway lands. These people have never heard about what I have done. They have never seen my glory. So the saved people will tell the nations about my glory.

18943.text: And they will bring all your fellow Israelites from all nations. They will bring them to my holy mountain in Jerusalem. Your fellow Israelites will come on horses, donkeys, camels and in chariots and wagons. They will be like the grain offerings that the people bring in clean containers to the Temple,” says the Lord.

18944.text: “And I will choose some of these people to be priests and Levites,” says the Lord.

18945.text: ¶“I will make new heavens and the new earth. And they will last forever,” says the Lord. “In the same way, your names and your children will always be with me.

18946.text: All people will come to worship me. They will come to worship me every Sabbath and every New Moon,” says the Lord.

18947.text: “They will go out and see the dead bodies of the people who sinned against me. The worms that eat them will never die. The fires that burn them will never stop. And everyone will hate to see those bodies.”
